programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Picard leaves the Enterprise to lead Worf and Dr Crusher on an espionage mission to Cardassia, in an effort to prevent war - but the task proves more dangerous than any of them anticipated. Ronny Cox and David Warner guest star

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Legendary villain Professor Moriarty is accidentally recreated and proceeds to wreak havoc aboard the Enterprise. Sci-fi adventure, guest starring Stephanie Beacham

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: The Enterprise crew investigates two suspicious deaths on a space station close to the Klingon border, but when Geordi reads the duty logs of one of the suspects, he starts to fall in love with her. Sci-fi drama, starring LeVar Burton and Patrick Stewart

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Troi wakes to discover she has been surgically transformed as part of Spock's plans to unite the Vulcans and Romulans. Sci-fi adventure, starring Marina Sirtis

programme.title: Super Cyclone (2012)
programme.desc: A gigantic storm is heading in the direction of America's west coast, and is poised to destroy everything in its path. A meteorologist has a daring plan for dispersing the storm and enlists the aid of an engineer to brave the elements and prevent a catastrophe. Disaster movie, starring Nicholas Turturro and Ming-Na

programme.title: Asteroid-a-geddon (2020)
programme.desc: A global summit fails to stop a massive asteroid headed straight for Earth. With the outlook bleak, a young tech genius assembles a team of specialists, using cutting-edge aeronautics, in a last-ditch effort to stop the rock before it's too late. Action adventure, starring Eric Roberts, Veronika Issa and Jennifer Wiggins

programme.title: Independence Daysaster (2013)
programme.desc: America's fourth of July celebrations are abruptly interrupted when Earth is invaded by hostile aliens. A maverick scientist and a small-town firefighter join forces to find and activate the only piece of technology in the world that can destroy the extraterrestrial army. Sci-fi thriller, starring Ryan Merriman and Tom Everett Scott

programme.title: The Twilight Zone
programme.desc: A woman's shopping trip goes awry when she takes the lift to a department store's 18th floor _ only to discover it shouldn't exist

programme.title: The Terrornauts (1967)
programme.desc: A group of scientists are kidnapped by robots from outer space and subjected to strange experiments. Sci-fi mystery, starring Simon Oates and Zena Marshall

programme.title: Night of the Big Heat (1967)
programme.desc: Invaders from outer space take over a remote Scottish island and raise the temperature to an unbearable level, giving residents little or no chance of survival. Sci-fi adventure, starring Christopher Lee, Peter Cushing and Patrick Allen

programme.title: The Loft (2014)
programme.desc: Five successful married men rent an apartment where they can carry out their extra-marital affairs in secret. The arrangement works well until they find the corpse of a beautiful woman handcuffed to a bed - but which of them is the killer, and how will the grisly discovery affect their friendship? Thriller, with Karl Urban, James Marsden and Wentworth Miller

programme.title: Extinction (2015)
programme.desc: Human civilisation is wiped out by a global viral outbreak that turns people into rabid killers. Two men find a safe retreat along with a nine-year-old girl in their care, but their hatred for each other grows over time. When the infected attack their hiding place, they must bury their differences if they are to survive. Sci-fi horror based on the novel by Juan de Dios Garduno, starring Matthew Fox and Jeffrey Donovan

programme.title: The Curse of Frankenstein (1957)
programme.desc: An obsessive scientist is determined to create life and builds a creature using parts taken from various corpses. He succeeds in animating the monster, but its brain is damaged in the process, driving it mad and causing it to embark on a killing spree. The first in Hammer's series of horror films inspired by Mary Shelley's novel, starring Peter Cushing and Christopher Lee

programme.title: Robbery (1967)
programme.desc: A criminal hatches a plot to rob the overnight mail train from Glasgow, assembling a gang of thieves and breaking a currency expert out of jail. Although the gang gets away with millions, a simple mistake while dividing up the loot puts the police on their trail. Drama, inspired by the Great Train Robbery, starring Stanley Baker, Frank Finlay and James Booth

programme.title: Star Trek
programme.desc: Dr McCoy travels back in time through a vortex and changes history, stranding the Enterprise crew on a distant planet. Kirk's only hope of rectifying the situation is to follow the doctor and retrieve him before he can do any harm - but in the process he is forced to make a personal sacrifice. With DeForest Kelley and guest star Joan Collins

programme.title: Pacific Heights (1990)
programme.desc: A couple buy their dream house and rent out a flat to a well-off bachelor who turns out to be the tenant from hell. He subjects them to a campaign of terror in a ploy to force them off the property - while the law appears to be always on his side. Psychological thriller, starring Michael Keaton, Melanie Griffith, Matthew Modine and Tippi Hedren

programme.title: Quarantine 2: Terminal (2011)
programme.desc: A plane is forced to make an emergency landing when one of the passengers develops a rabies-like virus. Panic spreads when the passengers realise they are being quarantined and left to die to prevent the spread of the infection, while a flight attendant tries to secretly get a group of passengers to safety. Horror sequel, with Mercedes Masohn and Josh Cooke

Angela Pleasence guest stars

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Newlyweds Luke and Kerry return from honeymoon and resume their duties, while Des Taviner is transferred to the Community Safety Unit, where his unorthodox methods and aggressive attitude soon cause friction. On the personal front, lovesick CID chief Jack Meadows makes a pass at Debbie McAllister, while June Ackland wonders whether she's done the right thing by asking Jim Carver to marry her

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Nick Klein's guilt and grief get the better of him at a memorial service for Simon Kitson, prompting an emotional outburst. Cathy Bradford's HIV lie gets even more out of hand, while Luke's soul-searching prompts him to tell Kerry the truth about his sexuality _ just as she gets an eyeful of new bobby Cameron Tait

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Sun Hill throws open its doors to members of the public as raw recruit PC Cameron Tait faces his first day on duty, shadowing the troubled PC Luke Ashton. programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: The station pulls together as Sun Hill unites in the search for Eva's daughter. Craig tells Kerry the truth about her husband

programme.desc: The staff await an important royal visit, but first Stan has to pick just the right toupee, and Bren is determined to get the tables cleared away in time. Comedy, starring Victoria Wood, Duncan Preston and Thelma Barlow

programme.desc: Philippa has a bright idea for raising the spirits of the kitchen staff. Comedy, starring Victoria Wood and Thelma Barlow

programme.desc: Morale plummets to its lowest point in the canteen with Tony in hospital and Dolly and Jean staging a walk-out, leaving Bren to run the graveyard shift single-handedly on the most important night of the year. Comedy, starring Victoria Wood, Andrew Dunn, Shobna Gulati and Celia Imrie

programme.title: dinnerladies
programme.desc: It is work experience day, but Bren cannot show the new girl a typical routine in the canteen because the new boy has blocked the front of the cooker with his ladder - which the bread delivery woman refuses to go under. Canteen comedy, with Victoria Wood, Thelma Barlow, Sue Cleaver and Shobna Gulati

programme.title: dinnerladies
programme.desc: Jean vents her anger on the customers, while Tony considers asking Bren to accompany him on a trip to Marbella. Petula returns with interesting news, and Anita celebrates the second week of her relationship with Pedro. Victoria Wood stars

programme.title: That Day We Sang
programme.desc: The members of a children's choir are reunited in 1969 for a TV documentary, 40 years after a historic recording at the Manchester Free Trade Hall. Middle-aged insurance salesman Tubby is on his own following the death of his mother, but he gets a glimpse of the boy he once was - and the man he could still be - after hearing the record for the first time in decades. At the same time, his fellow ex-chorister Enid lives in a safe world of her own construction, but as the music stirs powerful memories in both of them, dare they make a last grab for love? Imelda Staunton and Michael Ball star in this musical drama inspired by a true story, written and directed by Victoria Wood, with Conleth Hill, Lyndsey Marshal and Daniel Rigby

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: Jonathan seizes the opportunity to get his own back on a reviewer who criticised his show by refusing to reveal how his priceless painting was stolen, turning down a 50,000 reward in the process. A disgruntled Maddie must try and persuade him to let bygones be bygones. Drama, starring Alan Davies and Caroline Quentin, with a guest appearance by Bob Monkhouse

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: First of a two-part story. Adam Klaus's sister Kitty witnesses a murder in a country cottage in the woods during a night spent badger-watching with Maddy and Jonathan. Crime drama, with Alan Davies, guest starring Amanda Holden

programme.title: State of Play
programme.desc: Dominic Foy is edgy and obstructive during questioning, and Stephen tells Andrew Wilson to spin the news of Cal's affair with Anne in a bid to tarnish his rival's reputation. However, a sickening discovery threatens Stephen's own political career, forcing him to reconsider where his loyalties lie. David Morrissey and John Simm star

programme.title: Luther
programme.desc: Framed for murder and betrayed by one of his closest colleagues, the detective reluctantly accepts the aid of the calculating Alice Morgan, and turns to his love rival Mark North to help clear his name. Meanwhile, DSU Rose Teller struggles to come to terms with Luther's apparent crimes, and is forced to take ruthless action to bring him to justice. Thriller, starring Idris Elba, Ruth Wilson and Saskia Reeves

programme.title: Happy Valley
programme.desc: Catherine arrives home with Ilinka, an emaciated Croatian woman who has been rescued after being trafficked and enslaved for four years, and later arrests a lad at a high school who has been caught dealing drugs. Meanwhile John's panic over Vicky's threat spills out into his home life. Crime drama, starring Sarah Lancashire and Siobhan Finneran

programme.desc: On her first day in a new role, DI Annika Strandhed and her team are called in to solve the murder of a man found in the Clyde, a harpoon piercing his head. Crime drama, starring Nicola Walker

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: The duo are sent to investigate the discovery of a skeleton in an old Yorkshire mining town. When they are told the remains are those of a police officer who worked undercover during the miners' strike in the mid-1980s, the mismatched coppers begin to unravel a complex web of crimes. However, just when they think they are making progress, the killer strikes again

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team investigates the killing of a zookeeper, thought to have been mauled to death by a tiger in 2006, when blood found in the victim's lodgings suggests he was murdered before his body was placed in the big-cat enclosure. However, not all the team members are happy about the new case as Brian's animal rights tendencies come to the fore, bringing him into conflict with the zoo's PR. Alun Armstrong and Amanda Redman star

programme.title: Mistresses

programme.title: New Tricks

programme.desc: Sara Cox presents an appeal for Re-engage, a charity that provides life-enhancing social connections for the elderly to help them combat feelings of isolation and loneliness

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Chris Bavin is on hand to make the rural English dream a reality by presenting some beautiful properties to a couple returning to the UK after 20 years living abroad in Canada. They have a big budget to spend on a new home and are open to the countryside in either Worcestershire or Warwickshire

programme.title: Moana (2016)
programme.desc: A brave Polynesian teenager has been raised by her father to be the chief of her people, but longs to leave their island home for a life as an explorer. To save her people from a terrible curse, she sets sail in search of a legendary magical hero, and persuade him to set things right by returning a goddess' stolen heart. Disney animation, with the voices of Dwayne Johnson, Auli'i Cravalho, Rachel House and Temuera Morrison

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: A compilation of some of the most spectacular footage from the series, capturing wildlife from around the world on film using the latest camera technology, and revealing how they adapt to overcome the challenges posed by living in jungles, mountains, deserts, islands, grasslands and cities

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Charlotte Smith visits a farm in the Outer Hebrides during lambing season, while Paralympic athlete Sammi Kinghorn pays a visit to her family farm in the Scottish Borders, reflecting on how growing up here created a lifelong love of animals, but was also where she had the accident that caused her paralysis. Plus, how wool fleeces might be helping to making the UK's next great wine

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Portchester Castle on the Hampshire coast, where finds brought in include a previously unpublished poem by Siegfried Sassoon, a water-damaged letter that survived the sinking of the Titanic, a Victoria Cross medal, a rare cigarette lighter and a painting by one of the stars of the original Hawaii 5-0. Plus, Lee Young challenges Fiona to place a trio of model cars in order of value

programme.title: Charles R: The Making of a Monarch
programme.desc: The story of King Charles III's more than seven decades as heir to the throne, using archive material drawn from newsreels, home movies, interviews and documentaries. He reflects on his formative years from life at home with his family, his singular education, early experiences as a fledgling working royal, his time in the military and the roots of the many passions and causes that have been a feature of his time as Prince of Wales

programme.title: Great Expectations
programme.desc: Compeyson's return forces Miss Havisham comes face to face with her demons, and finally escape from her self-imposed seclusion. Estella also tries to break free after learning the identity of her father. Pip and Jaggers' plans come to a head when the sinking of Dorget's ship costs them dearly. While Jaggers strives to find a way to turn the situation to his advantage, Pip is plunged into suicidal despair

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman is joined by Alan Shearer and Gary Cahill to review the day's Premier League action, including Fulham v Manchester City at Craven Cottage and Liverpool v Tottenham Hotspur at Anfield. The Citizens faced a test of their title credentials against a Fulham side that have impressed this season. Liverpool claimed a 2-1 win over Spurs in the reverse fixture, but the Londoners looked to have the better chance of finishing in the top four. Plus, Bournemouth v Leeds United, Manchester United v Aston Villa and Newcastle United v Southampton

programme.title: The Women's Football Show
programme.desc: Highlights of the latest games in the Super League, including Aston Villa v Manchester United and Manchester City v Reading

programme.title: Beatriz at Dinner (2017)
programme.desc: A holistic medicine practitioner visits a wealthy client at home, only to find herself stranded when her car breaks down. The client invites her to attend a dinner party she is throwing that night, where she is drawn into a battle of wills with her privileged fellow guests. Comedy drama, starring Salma Hayek and John Lithgow

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Vick Hope and Gethin Jones host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Scam Interceptors
programme.desc: Rav Wilding and YouTuber Jim Browning join forces with ethical hackers to hunt down cyber criminals. Using the same remote-access technology that criminals use to scam their victims, the team hacks the hackers and monitors their operation

programme.title: Maximum Security
programme.desc: Dom Littlewood goes behind the scenes at some of Britain's most secure institutions. In the first episode, he joins Border Force at Dover as they stop drug smuggling

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Tommy Walsh is in Westcliff-on-Sea, Essex, to see a spacious five-bedroom end-of-terrace. Martel Maxwell is in St Leonards-on-Sea, East Sussex, to inspect a spectacular Grade II listed former church. Martin Roberts heads to Stroud, Gloucestershire, where he visits a top-floor one-bedroom flat boasting some stunning views. Later, they catch up with the new owners of all three properties, who share their plans for their acquisitions

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross presents the show from Shepton Mallet, Somerset, and challenges collectors to identify a mystery item connected to a local industry. With Kate Bliss and Colin Young

programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Zara plots with Al to save the Beechwalk, Jimmi and Nina take on the council, Kirsty gets the upper hand at home, and Suni has some bad news for a man planning a charity cycle

programme.title: Countryfile Spring Diaries
programme.desc: The return of the programme in which the Countryfile team look at the impact of spring's arrival around the nation, with John Craven heading to the Malvern Hills

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah helps a London couple to find a new home in the Monmouthshire countryside, and also takes her buyers to visit a market garden using a novel 'no dig' growing method

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers and expert auctioneer Simon Bower welcome five more people to the Bidding Room with another batch of weird and wonderful lots. The dealers bid against each other on two very decorative perfume bottles, an unusual box, two show-stopping pieces of African art, some rare ceramics and a unique light fitting

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc: Over three rounds, contestants vie to find the single 'unbeatable' answer and streak ahead of the rest to make the final where they can win a cash prize. General knowledge quiz, hosted by Jason Manford

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong is joined by co-host Rose Matafeo on the quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious answers to questions

programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Party Election Broadcast
programme.desc: By the Labour Party

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas launch Coronation week with a one-hour special looking at the work being done across the nations and communities of the UK in the run-up to Saturday's ceremony

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Keanu gets himself into more trouble at Albie's christening and Jay tries his best to make memories with Lola while he still can. Denise tries to take control of the situation between her and Jack and Alfie notices just how much Linda is struggling since she has lost Mick

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Nine more contenders enter the kitchen in the fourth round of heats, preparing a family favourite which Gregg Wallace and John Torode will judge blind, before granting three of the cooks a pass to the next round. The six remaining competitors face an invention test to earn their place in the contest, after which two will find themselves falling at the first hurdle

programme.title: Blue Lights
programme.desc: In the aftermath of the shooting, the recruits are determined the McIntyres will pay for what they have done. Stevie goes to arrest the MI5 operatives - but Joseph orders Jonty to let them go free. Tina demands that James tells Mo his dark secret, and Grace accepts that she might have to break her promise to Angela

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade hosts an extended episode of the satirical quiz, with political commentator Marina Purkiss and comedian Phil Wang joining Ian Hislop and Paul Merton

programme.title: Project Icon: The UK's Next Music Star
programme.desc: The three finalists each perform one of their own numbers and a live duet with Jason Derulo at an iconic Manchester music venue. Each singer will get time in the recording studios with Becky Hill before taking to the stage to perform in front of a live audience and the judges for the chance to win a record deal, a collaboration with Jason Derulo, and a performance at Radio 1's Big Weekend

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.desc: Rav Wilding joins forces with ethical hackers to hunt down cyber criminals. Using the same remote-access technology that criminals use to scam their victims, the team hacks the hackers and monitors their operation

programme.title: Maximum Security
programme.desc: Dom visits passport control at Heathrow before finding out how police horses are trained. He joins mounted police as they control the crowd at an Ed Sheeran concert in south Wales

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Two sets of siblings and a father and son team transform properties bought at auction in Leek, Selly Park and Aberfan

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: David Harper and Raj Bisram help the teams look for items at Ardingly International Antiques and Collectors Fair in West Sussex, while presenter Natasha Raskin Sharp visits a windmill that has been turned into a museum of rural life

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Zara goes undercover and Scarlett becomes Nina's latest recruit. Malika tries to help when a private midwife has a tricky birth to deal with and Bear is impressed by Tanisha

programme.title: Countryfile Spring Diaries
programme.desc: John Craven pays tribute to the Malvern Hills, while Keeley Donovan is in Scotland, investigating how an intruder is destroying the earthworm population

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah arrives in Devon to help a young couple search for a new home with enough land to start a glamping business. Along with the properties, they check out a lovely shepherd's hut and a luxury treehouse. Sonali also visits a farm that grows a number of delicious lettuce varieties without using soil

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Five dealers bid against one another to buy a spice box, two Chinese statues, a funfair horse, a 1900s cabinet and a dummy called Steve. Nigel Havers presents

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc: Over three rounds, contestants vie to find the single 'unbeatable' answer and streak ahead of the rest to make the final where they can win a cash prize. General knowledge quiz, hosted by Jason Manford

programme.title: Party Election Broadcast
programme.desc: By the Conservative Party

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas present another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Janine finally receives her sentence and the police offer Keanu a deal. Sonia gets the wrong idea when Reiss starts planning a big party, meanwhile Billy and Ben put together a plan to stop Jay from going under

programme.title: Sort Your Life Out with Stacey Solomon
programme.desc: Stacey challenges members of the Paine family to declutter their home in seven days. In order to do this, they have to let go of half their possessions so that they can then reorganise their property. There are emotional moments as single mother Steph and her three daughters go through their most treasured items, and make some difficult decisions about what to let go of from their past. The items they do decide to let go of will be put into piles to recycle, donate or sell. Plus, tidying and upcycling tips from carpenter Robert Bent, organiser Dilly Carter and cleaner Iwan Carrington

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The seven best home cooks from the first rounds of the competition return to the MasterChef kitchen to face two new challenges. Jimi Famurewa, one of the country's toughest food critics,sets the challenge for the chefs to cook a dish made of leftovers or waste. Only the best cooks will remain to go on to the second challenge, creating a dish celebrating citrus. Hosted by John Torode and Gregg Wallace

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Rain Dogs
programme.desc: When a visit with her family brings up some old demons, Costello confronts a secret from her past and finds the courage to leave Selby. After his behaviour in Bruton, Allegra arrives to help Selby clean up his act. Selby and Costello say an uncertain goodbye and Gloria receives some surprising news leaving her with a decision she doesn't feel ready to make

programme.title: Gossip Girl
programme.desc: Audrey juggles her father, his new girlfriend, and Kiki's launch, while Gossip Girl drives a wedge between her and Julien

programme.title: Gossip Girl
programme.desc: Julien helps Jess make a splash in the New York fashion world while Max and Audrey scheme to redeem Kiki's reputation at the expense of Aki's feelings

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is busy planting umbellifers and making some changes to the Dry Garden. He also sows peas and pots on his dahlias. Carol Klein reveals exciting plans for an ambitious show garden she's designing for the RHS Hampton Court Palace Garden Festival. With a ban on peat in compost on the way, Arit Anderson investigates what that means for the industry and gardeners alike

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Charles III has long been a champion of the countryside, so Charlotte Smith and Hamza Yassin travel to Dumfries House, a showcase for His Majesty's passion for rural life. Charlotte meets schoolchildren at the estate's education farm and garden to find out about the King's ambition to create the next generation of nature-loving food producers, and his mission to reinvigorate traditional crafts. Hamza discovers how the 2,000-acre estate has been transformed to help wildlife, and welcomes the newest residents to the walled garden - hedgehogs

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: The main potato crop goes in the ground, ready for harvesting later in the year, while Carole Baxter plants yellow rattle plugs in the lawn, which is a great plant to help encourage wildflowers as it inhibits the growth of grass and helps other species develop. Calum Clunie hast the latest developments at his allotment in Leven in Fife, and Kirsty Wilson has another in her series on house plant care

programme.title: Landward
programme.desc: Dougie Vipond walks north along the John o' Groats Trail, along the way meeting the man who created the route and finding out how it was inspired by the Appalachian Trail in Virginia. Rosie Morton is in Easter Ross to investigate how drones are being used to calculate how much carbon is locked away in farmland, and Arlene Stuart tests the responses of the Galloway Mountain Rescue team in a fast-water emergency scenario

programme.title: Weatherman Walking: The Welsh Coast
programme.desc: Derek Brockway is in Pembrokeshire, admiring its majestic cliffs constantly pounded by roaring waves. He really feels what it's like to be exposed to the elements as the skies open and it pours down. However, the inclement weather fails to prevent his trek from Abereiddy to Whitesands from proceeding. En route, the presenter peeks at some seal pups, learns how to train a sheepdog and builds a stone wall. He also helps to create a unique sand circle

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents more highlights from the series, offering viewers a chance to revisit some of their favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen

programme.title: Food & Drink
programme.desc: Chef Tom Kerridge is joined by Hairy Bikers duo Si King and Dave Myers and challenges them to come up with a speedy meal to rival his quick sausage and bean casserole, while drinks expert Joe Wadsack surprises them all with his choice of wine to match the food. Plus, Fast Show star Arabella Weir goes behind the scenes at one of London's most upmarket hotels to discover the secret to making the perfect sandwich

programme.title: Celebrity Best Home Cook
programme.desc: Claudia Winkleman hosts as the remaining three contestants take part in the final as they compete to be crowned the first-ever winner of the competition, with the cooks having to impress Mary Berry, Angela Hartnett and Chris Bavin if they're to win the title. First, the competitors take on the Rustle Up challenge, creating dishes that showcase butternut squash as the main ingredient, before being asked to produce their ultimate picnic and presenting their creations to the judges at a beautifully decorated picnic tables. Who will be crowned the winner?

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of the opening session of the final at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, where eight frames take place. Ronnie O'Sullivan and Judd Trump met in last year's final and O'Sullivan raced into an early lead, though Trump did fight back to win the last two frames of the opening session to leave the match finely poised at 5-3 going into the evening session

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin and the team examine antiques at Ashridge House, Hertfordshire. Thomas Plant discovers a marble cupid statue while a 19th-century brass microscope with an extensive collection of botanical slides catches the eye of Claire Rawle. Plus, the presenter takes time out to explore art at the Henry Moore Foundation in Much Hadham, which houses the largest collection of Moore's work

programme.title: Interior Design Masters
programme.desc: The two finalists are challenged to make over two pubs in a busy tourist hotspot in Brighton. One designer will be transforming an award-winning gastro pub with a field to fork ethos, while the other competitor is tasked with turning a traditional pub into a fun day-to-night venue aimed at a younger clientele. Once the challenge is compete, the pair head back to the design studio where they are cross examined by Alan and the judges. Who will be crowned this year's winner?

programme.title: Race Across the World
programme.desc: For the sixth leg of the race, the pairs must brush up on their language skills as the next stop is at the heart of French-speaking Canada, the capital of its largest province, Quebec. To get there, the teams must navigate through Canada's most densely inhabited region. For the first time in the race, transport and accommodation choices will be plentiful - but potentially damaging for dwindling budgets

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of the second session of the final at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, where nine frames take place. Ronnie O'Sullivan enjoyed a strong session at this stage of the 2022 tournament against Judd Trump, winning all but two of the frames to extend his lead to 12-5, the largest advantage he had held in any of the world finals he had played after the first day. His 118 break in the 11th frame was his 15th century of the tournament, a new personal best in a single year at the Crucible

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts an extended edition of the comedy panel game, with Ria Lina, Eshaan Akbar and Jimmy Carr joining regular Alan Davies to answer questions on the theme of tricks and treats

programme.title: The Wife (2017)
programme.desc: Successful writer Joe Castleman is delighted to receive an early morning telephone call from Sweden informing him that he has won this year's Nobel Prize in Literature. His steadfast wife Joan is equally delighted, but as she prepares to travel to Stockholm to support and encourage her husband, she reflects on her life from when she first met Joe, her married literature tutor with whom she embarks on the affair which would change the course of their lives. Oscar-nominated drama, starring Glenn Close, Jonathan Pryce and Max Irons

programme.title: The Mysterious Mr Lagerfeld
programme.desc: Award-winning director Michael Waldman goes in search of the real Karl Lagerfeld, who was one of the most flamboyant and recognisable figures in fashion, but also one of the most mysterious. Waldman tracks down those closest to the designer, including his friends, neighbour, lawyer, doctor, bodyguard and Chanel colleagues. He also meets the agent and nanny left in charge of Lagerfeld's cat, Choupette, who he called the love of his life and who earned an estimated three million euros from modelling assignments

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests in Greenford, west London, to answer questions from an invited audience on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week

programme.title: Wild Isles
programme.desc: David Attenborough introduces the colourful underwater world of Britain and Ireland's oceans, including thousands of grey seals congregating on the Norfolk shoreline to give birth. Rich beds of sea grass act as important carbon storage areas, as well as providing home for seahorses, while on the shallow seabed, the spider crab undergoes a mass migration of epic scale

programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents more highlights from the series, offering viewers a chance to revisit some of their favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick boards the King Harry ferry to enjoy a crossing voted one of the most scenic in the world, rustles up a vegetarian tart and investigates the Cornish influence on Oscar-Winning composer Malcolm Arnold with Radio 3 presenter Petroc Trewlawny

programme.title: Take a Hike
programme.desc: Police officer Mike from Rhyl takes the group on a stunning walk in Snowdonia, leading them around the picturesque lakes of Llyn Tern, Llyn Llydaw and Glaslyn

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win 10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of the third and penultimate session of the final at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, where eight frames are scheduled to be played. Judd Trump began the third session of last year's final with his first century of the match, and went on to win six of the eight frames played, reducing Ronnie O'Sullivan's lead to three at 14-11

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: Sara Pascoe hosts the start of the eighth series of the sewing competition, with 12 keen amateurs taking part, all judged by Savile Row tailor Patrick Grant and fashion designer Esme Young. They begin by making wool mini skirts with piped patch pockets, before transforming lockdown loungewear into adult tops suitable for a night out. For the made-to-measure task, each sewer must perfectly fit a wrap dress to their model. As ever, one hopeful is awarded garment of the week, while another becomes the first to be sent home

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: People are invited to try to make money out of their antiques by taking a risk at auction. Paul Martin presents

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Matt Edmondson, Sabrina Grant, Andy Hamilton and Kirsty Wark test their general knowledge in a variety of trivia-based games across the week, with a winner declared on Friday

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip
programme.desc: The newsreader travels around the country, immersing himself in Italian culture and sampling its renowned cuisine, beginning in the south-eastern region of Puglia. Clive discovers how the James Bond franchise helped turn an abandoned town into a world heritage site, finds out why Puglia is the gay holiday capital of Italy and learns to play in a traditional pizzica band

programme.title: Snooker: The World Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of the fourth and concluding session of the final at the Crucible Theatre in Sheffield, where the first player to reach 18 frames will be crowned champion. It was Ronnie O'Sullivan who took the honours last year for the seventh time in his career, winning four of the six frames in the final session against Judd Trump to record an 18-13 victory. The result ensured O'Sullivan ended the season as world number one, and he also became the oldest world champion in history as well as setting a new record for the most matches won at the Crucible, with 74

programme.title: Dolly: The Sheep That Changed the World
programme.desc: Documentary telling the story of the first mammal to be cloned, looking at the impact this monumental scientific achievement in 1996 had on the world. The film reveals how a handful of the world's best genetic scientists worked in secret on a small Scottish farm to crack the holy grail of replicating life

programme.title: The Road Dance (2021)
programme.desc: Kirsty Macleod dreams of a better life away from the isolation that suffocates her in a small village on an island in the Outer Hebrides. Suppressing these aspirations, she sees her lover Murdo conscripted for service in the First World War, soon to set off and fight alongside the other young men from the village. A dance is held in their honour the evening before they depart, and it's on this fateful night that Kirsty's life takes a dramatic and tragic turn. Period drama, starring Hermione Corfield

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Charles III has long been a champion of the countryside, so Charlotte Smith and Hamza Yassin travel to Dumfries House, a showcase for His Majesty's passion for rural life. Charlotte meets schoolchildren at the estate's education farm and garden to find out about the King's ambition to create the next generation of nature-loving food producers, and his mission to reinvigorate traditional crafts. Hamza discovers how the 2,000-acre estate has been transformed to help wildlife, and welcomes the newest residents to the walled garden - hedgehogs

programme.title: Reunion Hotel
programme.desc: Kwesi, 70, checks in to the hotel in north Wales in the hope of meeting his daughter Ruth, who was adopted at birth. Childhood friends Noah and Matt haven't seen each other for more than 12 years, but want to reconnect after an often-difficult teenage relationship. And a group of women who became the first all-female relay expedition to the North Pole hope to have a long-awaited reunion. Alex Jones presents

programme.title: Love, Faith and Me
programme.desc: Happily married couple Saul and Shoshi hope that following Jewish marriage rituals can help them through the tough times. As young Orthodox Jews they participate in the sacred ritual of the Mikvah and sleep in separate beds for 12 days of every month

programme.title: Dr Xand's Con or Cure
programme.desc: Xand Van Tulleken considers the deadly effects of diet pills and whether breakfast truly is the most important meal. Plus, the myth that local honey helps hayfever is busted

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip
programme.desc: The newsreader travels around the country, immersing himself in Italian culture and sampling its renowned cuisine, beginning in the south-eastern region of Puglia. Clive discovers how the James Bond franchise helped turn an abandoned town into a world heritage site, finds out why Puglia is the gay holiday capital of Italy and learns to play in a traditional pizzica band

programme.title: Coast to Coast Food Festival
programme.desc: Edith Bowman and Colin Murray explore the Foodies Festival in Glasgow, where they discover the secrets to the best egg fried rice with chef Jimmy Lee and how to spot fake vanilla. Chef Julie Lin digs deep to reveal some myths about frozen food and farmer Jim Smith learns the art of pickling, and discovers why one farm is turning its oats into milk

programme.title: Coastal Defenders
programme.desc: A mooring structure on the Isle of Wight ferries is in desperate need of repair, bringing the entire terminal to a standstill. The dive team arrive to repair the seaworn structure, working day and night to get the job done on time, but the task is made worse when they come across a mountain of discarded rubbish ranging from teacups to prams

programme.desc: Sara Cox presents an appeal for Re-engage, a charity that provides life-enhancing social connections for the elderly to help them combat feelings of isolation and loneliness

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: The latest stories from Westminster and beyond

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win 10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: My Million Pound Menu
programme.desc: Fred Sirieix presents this new show which follows people who work in the food business as they seek major investment to launch their own restaurants. They have their concepts and branding - all they need now is the financial backing. First up is Epoch, comprising Manchester chef Ruth and sommelier Emily, who have an idea to pair British wines with the best seasonal produce. Meanwhile, Scotsman Ewen Hutchinson hopes to take his award-winning street food to the next level by opening his own establishment

programme.title: Atlantic: The Wildest Ocean on Earth
programme.desc: Cillian Murphy narrates a documentary examining the lives of animals and people pitting themselves against the world's wildest ocean, unveiling the natural forces that underpin life in the Atlantic, from the world's most powerful currents, ferocious hurricanes and huge chains of undersea volcanoes. The first episode looks at the influence of the Gulf Stream, with whales, giant turtles and jellyfish riding the huge current that becomes a migration super-highway and helps warm northern Europe, while fishermen battle for survival in mountainous seas as they try to exploit its natural fertility

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: Sara Pascoe presents a trio of sports-themed sewing challenges, including a Sewing Bee first - a pair of trainers, which includes unfamiliar techniques such as punching eyelets and stitching soles. That's followed by transforming an old netball kit into a garment to be worn off the court and a made-to-measure jacket inspired by their sporting hero

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Catherine Southon and Nick Hall assess items brought to Boconnoc House in Cornwall, and presenter Paul Martin participates in a traditional Cornish gig race

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Matt Edmondson, Sabrina Grant, Andy Hamilton and Kirsty Wark test their general knowledge in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip
programme.desc: Godfather fan Clive is in Sicily, where he visits the village that Francis Ford Coppola used to film a wedding in his classic movie The Godfather. He also joins geologists working on Mount Etna to predict its next eruption and heads to Modica to learn how to make a chocolate bar from an ancient recipe

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Mediterranean Adventure
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers get back on their bikes to explore the culinary delights of several Mediterranean countries, discovering hearty and healthy food from France, Spain and Italy. They begin by searching for the authentic flavours of Italy, from simple local ingredients to spicy nduja pate and some of the best gelato around

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace pays a visit to the Ambrosia factory in Lifton, Devon, to lift the lid on the 400g tin of rice pudding - one of the company's best sellers. He follows the process from the preparation of the rice and the blending of the milk to filling the cans, cooking and labelling - with up to 360,000 tins produced every day. Cherry Healey finds out about the millions of tons of rice grown in Italy's Po Valley every year and Ruth Goodman looks at the history of school dinners

programme.title: Highland Cops
programme.desc: Officers conduct a raid after they are tipped off about a Skye resident suspected of possessing an illegal weapon, while high winds cause a road traffic incident on Harris in which a car has flipped over several times. In Kirkwall, PC Simon Hay watches over the Horse March, an Orcadian tradition going back centuries that sees up to 100 horses and riders gather from across the island

programme.title: Colin from Accounts
programme.desc: Ash and Gordon's awkward sexual encounter causes them to drift apart. Comedy, starring Patrick Brammall and Harriet Dyer

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Mark Urban

programme.title: Shadowlands (1993)
programme.desc: Fact-based drama about the later life of novelist CS Lewis, detailing how he fell in love with American poet Joy Gresham, only to see his new-found happiness marred by tragedy and illness. Directed by Richard Attenborough and starring Anthony Hopkins, Debra Winger, Edward Hardwicke, John Wood, Michael Denison and Joseph Mazzello

programme.title: Pilgrimage
programme.desc: Continuing their travels are actresses Su Pollard and Rita Simons, Shane Lynch of Boyzone fame, reality TV star Vicky Pattison, TV personality Bobby Seagull, comedian Nabil Abdulrashid and Paralympian skier Millie Knight. The pilgrims wake up in the village of Vitorino Dos Piaes in Northern Portugal, and decide to make a quick detour to The Sanctuary of Bom Jesus do Monte

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Nine home cooks take on the audition round in the second week of heats, hoping to impress John and Gregg who are blind taste-testing their dishes and picking the top three to fast track into the next round of the competition. The remaining six cooks face an invention test under the watchful eye of John and Gregg and two will be going home

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Around the World in 80 Treasures
programme.desc: Dan Cruickshank heads for Mali to visit Dogon country, where he examines masks said to connect the land of the living with that of the dead, and admires ancient paintings

programme.title: The Queen's Realm
programme.desc: In a documentary originally broadcast in 1977, Sian Phillips introduces a Silver Jubilee year report on the contrary country west of Offa's Dyke, which is the pride of some of its inhabitants and the despair of many others

programme.title: Dance Passion Liverpool: Find the Feeling
programme.desc: A day in the life of the city through a series of dances, as soloists, choreographers and troupes - both amateur and professional - use pavements and landmarks as their stage, performing everything from high-energy Afrodance and beautiful ballet to energetic hopak and vibrant vogueing

programme.title: The Prince and the Composer
programme.desc: In a documentary first shown in 2011, the then Prince Charles profiles composer Hubert Parry, who is best known for the choral song Jerusalem and the well-loved hymn Dear Lord and Father of Mankind. With the help of Parry's family, as well as scholars and performers, the royal presenter explores the complex character behind the popular pieces of music

programme.title: David Copperfield
programme.desc: Now an ambitious young man making a name for himself in London, David returns to Suffolk with his schoolfriend Steerpike in tow to catch up with Peggoty, his late mother's maid. Adaptation of the Dickens classic, starring Pauline Quirke and Ciaran McMenamin

programme.title: The Price of Everything (2018)
programme.desc: Documentary that explores the labyrinthine art world of the 21st century and examines both the place of art and artistic passion in a money-driven, consumer-based society. Featuring collectors, dealers, auctioneers and artists including Jeff Koons, Gerhard Richter and Njideka Akunyili Crosby and Larry Poons, the film exposes deep contradictions as it holds a mirror up to the values of the modern era, coaxing out the dynamics at play in pricing the priceless

programme.title: For Folk's Sake: Morris Dancing and Me
programme.desc: Richard Macer infiltrates morris dancing's endangered world of bells, beer and beards, discovering that women may be the unlikely saviours of this ancient masculine tradition

programme.title: The Queen's Realm
programme.desc: In a documentary originally broadcast in 1977, Sian Phillips introduces a Silver Jubilee year report on the contrary country west of Offa's Dyke, which is the pride of some of its inhabitants and the despair of many others

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels to Java's Central Province and the royal city of Yogyakarta, where he visits the Sultan's Palace and admires the ancient art of shadow puppetry. Moving north to Ambawara, Michael boards a scenic heritage line constructed by the Dutch with carriages dating from the time of his Bradshaw's guidebook

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc: Narrowboater Robbie Cumming begins a fresh set of adventures along the waterways of the north of England and the Midlands. He is forced to make a running repair to his narrowboat the Naughty Lass while on the Tinsley lock flight in South Yorkshire. He then cruises beneath Conisbrough's magnificent viaduct and must wait for an unusual sliding railway bridge to open on the Stainforth and Keadby Canal

programme.title: Inside the Bat Cave
programme.desc: Lucy Cooke presents a documentary taking a journey into the secret world of one of the most endangered and least understood animals on Earth - bats. With cutting-edge night-vision cameras and ultrasonic detectors, this programme follows a greater horseshoe bat roost for four months, capturing the hidden life of the colony as never before, witnessing the birth of a new generation of pups and tracking their progress towards their perilous maiden flights outside the roost

programme.title: An Art Lovers' Guide
programme.desc: Janina Ramirez and Alastair Sooke discover the art and architecture of Barcelona, seeking out the Romanesque frescoes that inspired a young Mir and the designs of an engineer who arguably put more of a stamp on the city than its star architect, Antoni Gaud

programme.title: This Cultural Life
programme.desc: John Wilson talks to Margaret Atwood, who traces her writing back to sagas that she invented with her brother as a child. She recalls an opera about fabrics that she wrote and performed at high school for a home economics project, how she staged puppet shows for children's parties, and the huge impact that reading George Orwell had on her

programme.title: A Portrait of Carol Shields: Dressing Up for the Carnival
programme.desc: Documentary charting the distinguished career of the award-winning novelist and the long battle with cancer to which she succumbed in 2003 at the age of 68. Born in Chicago in 1957, Carol Shields settled in Canada and went on to raise five children and publish 16 novels, scooping the Pulitzer Prize for her book The Stone Diaries along the way. Interview footage with Carol, her daughters and a selection of her literary peers highlight the life of a gentle unassuming writer

programme.title: Novels That Shaped Our World
programme.desc: Documentary examining the impact of novels from three perspectives - the empire, class experience and, in this first film, women's voices. The programme aims to show the plight of women is a theme that reaches right back to the earliest novels, with extracts from Jane Austen, the Brontes, Mary Shelley and Virginia Woolf, through to the post-war publishing boom where a new generation of global writers such as Zadie Smith, Toni Morrison, Arundhati Roy and Margaret Atwood have continued to speak out for women to a new generation of readers

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels to Java's Central Province and the royal city of Yogyakarta, where he visits the Sultan's Palace and admires the ancient art of shadow puppetry. Moving north to Ambawara, Michael boards a scenic heritage line constructed by the Dutch with carriages dating from the time of his Bradshaw's guidebook

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc: Narrowboater Robbie Cumming begins a fresh set of adventures along the waterways of the north of England and the Midlands. programme.title: Craftivism: Making a Difference
programme.desc: Writer, comedian and art lover Jenny Eclair meets people doing extraordinary things with knitting, cross-stitch, banners and felt to change hearts and minds across the world

programme.title: The Prince and the Composer
programme.desc: In a documentary first shown in 2011, the then Prince Charles profiles composer Hubert Parry, who is best known for the choral song Jerusalem and the well-loved hymn Dear Lord and Father of Mankind. With the help of Parry's family, as well as scholars and performers, the royal presenter explores the complex character behind the popular pieces of music

programme.title: Great Asian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey through south-east Asia, learning how coffee was first brought to Java for cultivation, visiting the headquarters of the Dutch East Indies Railway Company, and ending at Surabaya, a port bursting with local traditions, produce and culture

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc: Robbie Cumming tackles the fast-flowing River Trent and is invited to join a night-time illuminated boat parade. However, his journey is hampered by a damaged wall in Worksop and a water shortage on the Chesterfield Canal which threatens his voyage

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel becomes suspicious of Alistair's overwhelming desire for his book to be a success. Comedy, starring Geoffrey Palmer and Judi Dench

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads?
programme.desc: Bob has doubts about his marriage when he realises all his peers - even the vicar - seem to be getting divorced. Classic comedy, starring Rodney Bewes and James Bolam

programme.title: King Arthur's Britain: The Truth Unearthed
programme.desc: With access to a major new excavation on the Tintagel peninsula in Cornwall, Professor Alice Roberts pulls together the latest evidence to reveal what Dark Age Britain was really like. Long known to have been a Dark Ages settlement, the new evidence reveals that Tintagel was also a seat of power, and Alice explores the link between the location and Arthurian legend, tracking down the early sources for the period and the first written reference to King Arthur

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: Detailed account of the bloody uprising at a New York State prison in 1971. Over 1,000 inmates took control of Attica Correctional Facility, seizing 39 hostages in the process. Their demands related mainly to the inhumane conditions they were forced to endure, but a huge police assault and a hail of gunfire killed 29 convicts and 10 innocents, an action that has left many survivors, both guards and inmates, seeking compensation

programme.title: Colour: The Spectrum of Science
programme.desc: Dr Helen Czerski tells the story of scientific endeavour, revealing the secrets of the universe as she takes to the skies in a jumbo jet, equipped with an infra-red telescope. She explores how the birds and the bees, who can see ultraviolet, view the world, and looks at how x-rays can be used to harness colours and image the human body as never before, thereby opening up new ways to treat disease

programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey through south-east Asia, learning how coffee was first brought to Java for cultivation, visiting the headquarters of the Dutch East Indies Railway Company, and ending at Surabaya, a port bursting with local traditions, produce and culture

Finally, Elder Panda arrives and manages to bring it down to the ground using an umbrella, and Love Monster comes clean, saying how sorry he is. programme.title: My World Kitchen
programme.desc: Lola's family are from Spain, a country in southern Europe. She is making a traditional Spanish dish called empanadas for her and her friends. Lola begins by rolling out two pieces of pizza dough into big circles. She cooks one in the oven. Lola adds tomato puree to passata to make the filling. She also adds some canned tuna, green olives, and boiled egg. She seasons the mixture with paprika, black pepper and her special ingredient, oregano. Then Lola spreads the filling over the dough, which has been in the oven. She finishes the recipe by adding the last piece of dough on top and then putting it back in the oven to cook. Will Lola's friends find the empanadas tasty? Will they guess her special ingredient? There's a very exciting Spanish surprise waiting for her friends while they enjoy their meal!

Communicating through his walkie-talkie, Tag doesn't know where he is. He can see lots and lots of things around him, but no-one has any idea where this room is in the house. As Duggee listens to Tag describe what's in the room, he realises that Tag must be in the lost property room. But Duggee doesn't know where in the house that is. Brighton and Brentford will have their sights set on securing European football next season, while Palace had enjoyed an improvement in form under returning manager Roy Hodgson, and Wolves, West Ham and Forest are among a number of teams battling against relegation

programme.title: Truckers: Life on the Road
programme.desc: MD Ian's stress levels are up. He's ordered 40 brand new greener trucks that can run on hydrogenated vegetable oil. The new hi-tech vehicles are fitted with cameras in place of mirrors to increase visibility - but company stalwart and long-time driver the Donk is not convinced. It's naming day for bin man Jason's new litter, while trucker Tigger battles her way through the medieval streets of York

programme.title: Wynne's Welsh 70s
programme.desc: Wynne Evans turns his attention to the BBC Wales archive of 1971. His highlights include music from Harry Secombe, The Tom Jones Show and a visit to Max Boyce's old stomping ground. Plus, a female private eye swaps her trench coat for a beauty contest bikini, there's a Christmas baby competition in Neath and Earth Kitt reveals the heartache of being abandoned as a baby

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Aled Jones visits Highgrove House ahead of the Coronation, and reflects on how the gardens are a testament to King Charles' lifelong desire to champion environmental causes. Gyles Brandreth recalls important events that have shaped the life and faith of King Charles and discusses the pioneering work of The Prince's Trust. The Dean of Westminster reveals the preparations for the upcoming ceremony and about the sacred symbols used in Coronations

programme.title: Points of View
programme.desc: Viewers' opinions on BBC shows and behind-the-scenes reports on new programmes

programme.title: Lifeline
programme.desc: Sara Cox presents an appeal for Re-engage, a charity that provides life-enhancing social connections for the elderly to help them combat feelings of isolation and loneliness

programme.title: Moana (2016)
programme.desc: A brave Polynesian teenager has been raised by her father to be the chief of her people, but longs to leave their island home for a life as an explorer. To save her people from a terrible curse, she sets sail in search of a legendary magical hero, and persuade him to set things right by returning a goddess' stolen heart. Disney animation, with the voices of Dwayne Johnson, Auli'i Cravalho, Rachel House and Temuera Morrison

programme.title: Weatherman Walking
programme.desc: Derek Brockway heads to Llandudno to explore the rugged beauty of Great Orme, a giant headland overlooking the Irish Sea. Along the way he visits St Tudno's church and copper mines that date back 4,000 years

programme.title: Iolo's Borderlands
programme.desc: Iolo Williams explores north-east Wales, beginning his journey on a moor near Llangollen to see hen harriers, one of the UK's most threatened birds of prey. He also visits a nature reserve on a bog, discovers the wildlife that has colonised Marford Quarry, and ends his journey on the Dee Estuary, where he sees thousands of wading birds near Point of Ayr

programme.title: Reunion Hotel
programme.desc: Arleen, the daughter of a Holocaust survivor, thanks Chris, the man whose grandparents hid her mother to save her life. Alex Jones also meets ex-soldier Nathan, who was sent to Belfast for his first operational tour at 18. His behaviour took a downward spiral, including what he recalls as causing trouble for his commanding officer, so he seeks forgiveness from his former platoon officer

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Charlotte Smith visits a farm in the Outer Hebrides during lambing season, while Paralympic athlete Sammi Kinghorn pays a visit to her family farm in the Scottish Borders, reflecting on how growing up here created a lifelong love of animals, but was also where she had the accident that caused her paralysis. Plus, how wool fleeces might be helping to making the UK's next great wine

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Portchester Castle on the Hampshire coast, where finds brought in include a previously unpublished poem by Siegfried Sassoon, a water-damaged letter that survived the sinking of the Titanic, a Victoria Cross medal, a rare cigarette lighter and a painting by one of the stars of the original Hawaii 5-0. Plus, Lee Young challenges Fiona to place a trio of model cars in order of value

programme.title: Charles R: The Making of a Monarch
programme.desc: The story of King Charles III's more than seven decades as heir to the throne, using archive material drawn from newsreels, home movies, interviews and documentaries. He reflects on his formative years from life at home with his family, his singular education, early experiences as a fledgling working royal, his time in the military and the roots of the many passions and causes that have been a feature of his time as Prince of Wales

programme.title: Great Expectations
programme.desc: Compeyson's return forces Miss Havisham comes face to face with her demons, and finally escape from her self-imposed seclusion. Estella also tries to break free after learning the identity of her father. Pip and Jaggers' plans come to a head when the sinking of Dorget's ship costs them dearly. While Jaggers strives to find a way to turn the situation to his advantage, Pip is plunged into suicidal despair

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman is joined by Alan Shearer and Gary Cahill to review the day's Premier League action, including Fulham v Manchester City at Craven Cottage and Liverpool v Tottenham Hotspur at Anfield. The Citizens faced a test of their title credentials against a Fulham side that have impressed this season. Liverpool claimed a 2-1 win over Spurs in the reverse fixture, but the Londoners looked to have the better chance of finishing in the top four. Plus, Bournemouth v Leeds United, Manchester United v Aston Villa and Newcastle United v Southampton

programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Aled Jones visits Highgrove House ahead of the Coronation, and reflects on how the gardens are a testament to King Charles' lifelong desire to champion environmental causes. Gyles Brandreth recalls important events that have shaped the life and faith of King Charles and discusses the pioneering work of The Prince's Trust. The Dean of Westminster reveals the preparations for the upcoming ceremony and about the sacred symbols used in Coronations

programme.title: Points of View
programme.desc: Viewers' opinions on BBC shows and behind-the-scenes reports on new programmes

programme.title: Lifeline
programme.desc: Sara Cox presents an appeal for Re-engage, a charity that provides life-enhancing social connections for the elderly to help them combat feelings of isolation and loneliness

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Chris Bavin is on hand to make the rural English dream a reality by presenting some beautiful properties to a couple returning to the UK after 20 years living abroad in Canada. They have a big budget to spend on a new home and are open to the countryside in either Worcestershire or Warwickshire

programme.title: Moana (2016)
programme.desc: A brave Polynesian teenager has been raised by her father to be the chief of her people, but longs to leave their island home for a life as an explorer. To save her people from a terrible curse, she sets sail in search of a legendary magical hero, and persuade him to set things right by returning a goddess' stolen heart. Disney animation, with the voices of Dwayne Johnson, Auli'i Cravalho, Rachel House and Temuera Morrison

programme.title: Scotland Sings
programme.desc: Part one of two. Vocal coach Yvie Burnett puts together a choir made up of people who lack confidence, have had setbacks or feel socially isolated, training them for performance on stage at the Hydro in Glasgow. Yvie has some tough decisions to make as she must choose who to select solely from video clips and enlists help from both her family and trusted friend Myleene Klass

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Charlotte Smith visits a farm in the Outer Hebrides during lambing season, while Paralympic athlete Sammi Kinghorn pays a visit to her family farm in the Scottish Borders, reflecting on how growing up here created a lifelong love of animals, but was also where she had the accident that caused her paralysis. Plus, how wool fleeces might be helping to making the UK's next great wine

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Portchester Castle on the Hampshire coast, where finds brought in include a previously unpublished poem by Siegfried Sassoon, a water-damaged letter that survived the sinking of the Titanic, a Victoria Cross medal, a rare cigarette lighter and a painting by one of the stars of the original Hawaii 5-0. Plus, Lee Young challenges Fiona to place a trio of model cars in order of value

programme.title: Charles R: The Making of a Monarch
programme.desc: The story of King Charles III's more than seven decades as heir to the throne, using archive material drawn from newsreels, home movies, interviews and documentaries. He reflects on his formative years from life at home with his family, his singular education, early experiences as a fledgling working royal, his time in the military and the roots of the many passions and causes that have been a feature of his time as Prince of Wales

programme.title: Great Expectations
programme.desc: Compeyson's return forces Miss Havisham comes face to face with her demons, and finally escape from her self-imposed seclusion. Estella also tries to break free after learning the identity of her father. Pip and Jaggers' plans come to a head when the sinking of Dorget's ship costs them dearly. While Jaggers strives to find a way to turn the situation to his advantage, Pip is plunged into suicidal despair

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman is joined by Alan Shearer and Gary Cahill to review the day's Premier League action, including Fulham v Manchester City at Craven Cottage and Liverpool v Tottenham Hotspur at Anfield. The Citizens faced a test of their title credentials against a Fulham side that have impressed this season. Liverpool claimed a 2-1 win over Spurs in the reverse fixture, but the Londoners looked to have the better chance of finishing in the top four. Plus, Bournemouth v Leeds United, Manchester United v Aston Villa and Newcastle United v Southampton

programme.title: Sportscene
programme.desc: Rangers v Celtic. Highlights of the second Scottish Cup semi-final, which took place at Hampden Park

programme.title: The Women's Football Show
programme.desc: Highlights of the latest games in the Super League, including Aston Villa v Manchester United and Manchester City v Reading

programme.title: Beatriz at Dinner (2017)
programme.desc: A holistic medicine practitioner visits a wealthy client at home, only to find herself stranded when her car breaks down. The client invites her to attend a dinner party she is throwing that night, where she is drawn into a battle of wills with her privileged fellow guests. Comedy drama, starring Salma Hayek and John Lithgow

In order to do this, they have to let go of half their possessions so that they can then reorganise their property. There are emotional moments as single mother Steph and her three daughters go through their most treasured items, and make some difficult decisions about what to let go of from their past. The items they do decide to let go of will be put into piles to recycle, donate or sell. Plus, tidying and upcycling tips from carpenter Robert Bent, organiser Dilly Carter and cleaner Iwan Carrington
