programme.desc: Over three rounds, contestants vie to find the single 'unbeatable' answer and streak ahead of the rest to make the final where they can win a cash prize. General knowledge quiz, hosted by Jason Manford

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong is joined by co-host Rose Matafeo on the quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious answers to questions

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Party Election Broadcast
programme.desc: By the Alliance Party

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas launch Coronation week with a one-hour special looking at the work being done across the nations and communities of the UK in the run-up to Saturday's ceremony

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Keanu gets himself into more trouble at Albie's christening and Jay tries his best to make memories with Lola while he still can. Denise tries to take control of the situation between her and Jack and Alfie notices just how much Linda is struggling since she has lost Mick

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: Nine more contenders enter the kitchen in the fourth round of heats, preparing a family favourite which Gregg Wallace and John Torode will judge blind, before granting three of the cooks a pass to the next round. The six remaining competitors face an invention test to earn their place in the contest, after which two will find themselves falling at the first hurdle

programme.title: Blue Lights
programme.desc: In the aftermath of the shooting, the recruits are determined the McIntyres will pay for what they have done. Stevie goes to arrest the MI5 operatives - but Joseph orders Jonty to let them go free. Tina demands that James tells Mo his dark secret, and Grace accepts that she might have to break her promise to Angela

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Bikes!
programme.desc: Stephen Watson presents action from Ireland's oldest road race, as the riders negotiated laps of the 2.1-mile Orritor Circuit in the event's centenary year

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade hosts an extended episode of the satirical quiz, with political commentator Marina Purkiss and comedian Phil Wang joining Ian Hislop and Paul Merton

programme.title: Project Icon: The UK's Next Music Star
programme.desc: The three finalists each perform one of their own numbers and a live duet with Jason Derulo at an iconic Manchester music venue. Each singer will get time in the recording studios with Becky Hill before taking to the stage to perform in front of a live audience and the judges for the chance to win a record deal, a collaboration with Jason Derulo, and a performance at Radio 1's Big Weekend

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Scam Interceptors
programme.desc: Rav Wilding joins forces with ethical hackers to hunt down cyber criminals. Using the same remote-access technology that criminals use to scam their victims, the team hacks the hackers and monitors their operation

programme.title: Maximum Security
programme.desc: Dom visits passport control at Heathrow before finding out how police horses are trained. He joins mounted police as they control the crowd at an Ed Sheeran concert in south Wales

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Two sets of siblings and a father and son team transform properties bought at auction in Leek, Selly Park and Aberfan

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: David Harper and Raj Bisram help the teams look for items at Ardingly International Antiques and Collectors Fair in West Sussex, while presenter Natasha Raskin Sharp visits a windmill that has been turned into a museum of rural life

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Zara goes undercover and Scarlett becomes Nina's latest recruit. Malika tries to help when a private midwife has a tricky birth to deal with and Bear is impressed by Tanisha

programme.title: Countryfile Spring Diaries
programme.desc: John Craven pays tribute to the Malvern Hills, while Keeley Donovan is in Scotland, investigating how an intruder is destroying the earthworm population

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah arrives in Devon to help a young couple search for a new home with enough land to start a glamping business. Along with the properties, they check out a lovely shepherd's hut and a luxury treehouse. Sonali also visits a farm that grows a number of delicious lettuce varieties without using soil

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Five dealers bid against one another to buy a spice box, two Chinese statues, a funfair horse, a 1900s cabinet and a dummy called Steve. Nigel Havers presents

programme.title: Unbeatable
programme.desc: Over three rounds, contestants vie to find the single 'unbeatable' answer and streak ahead of the rest to make the final where they can win a cash prize. General knowledge quiz, hosted by Jason Manford

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Ria Lina

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Party Election Broadcast
programme.desc: By the Social Democratic and Labour Party

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas present another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Janine finally receives her sentence and the police offer Keanu a deal. Sonia gets the wrong idea when Reiss starts planning a big party, meanwhile Billy and Ben put together a plan to stop Jay from going under

programme.title: Sort Your Life Out with Stacey Solomon
programme.desc: Stacey challenges members of the Paine family to declutter their home in seven days. In order to do this, they have to let go of half their possessions so that they can then reorganise their property. There are emotional moments as single mother Steph and her three daughters go through their most treasured items, and make some difficult decisions about what to let go of from their past. The items they do decide to let go of will be put into piles to recycle, donate or sell. Plus, tidying and upcycling tips from carpenter Robert Bent, organiser Dilly Carter and cleaner Iwan Carrington

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The seven best home cooks from the first rounds of the competition return to the MasterChef kitchen to face two new challenges. Jimi Famurewa, one of the country's toughest food critics,sets the challenge for the chefs to cook a dish made of leftovers or waste. Only the best cooks will remain to go on to the second challenge, creating a dish celebrating citrus. Hosted by John Torode and Gregg Wallace

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Made Up in Belfast
programme.desc: Things aren't going to plan in Ibiza so Brendan puts Emma in charge of saving the store and 'Operation Ibiza Rescue'. In Belfast, the team hold a warehouse sale to make space for Christmas stock and Jamie is torn between going ahead with his pancake business or going back to university

programme.title: Made Up in Belfast
programme.desc: Brendan receives the chance to expand the brand into a major high street pharmacy so the team head to Manchester to engage the local make up artists in their products. James is given the responsibility of making a speech but is asked to dial down his performance and make sure to focus on the brand. Emma tells the girls she has to have a serious operation on her spine

programme.title: Rain Dogs
programme.desc: When a visit with her family brings up some old demons, Costello confronts a secret from her past and finds the courage to leave Selby. After his behaviour in Bruton, Allegra arrives to help Selby clean up his act. Selby and Costello say an uncertain goodbye and Gloria receives some surprising news leaving her with a decision she doesn't feel ready to make

programme.title: Gossip Girl
programme.desc: Audrey juggles her father, his new girlfriend, and Kiki's launch, while Gossip Girl drives a wedge between her and Julien

programme.title: Gossip Girl
programme.desc: Julien helps Jess make a splash in the New York fashion world while Max and Audrey scheme to redeem Kiki's reputation at the expense of Aki's feelings

programme.desc: Rajan Datar's in Malaga taking a look at some of the surveillance tech that's watching you on your holidays. programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Click
programme.desc: Click explores the latest developments in music tech. Spencer Kelly meets a virtual band in South Korea. Nick Kwek finds out about gigging in the metaverse. Also, LJ Rich tries out the tech helping musicians from around the world collaborate in real-time.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Extreme Conservation
programme.desc: In Extreme Conservation, presenter Michaela Strachan travels the world meeting people battling the effects of climate change, who are intervening in extreme ways to save species or entire ecosystems. In this edition, Michaela is in the Maldives, which is facing an existential challenge from global warming - its picture-postcard sand islands are literally being washed from the map. Research teams from around the world have been invited in to work with local scientists to try to quickly develop solutions before it's too late, and she meets those behind some of the more ambitious projects. Coral reefs are key to protecting the islands from storms and surges, but as the oceans warm, they are being killed off by coral bleaching. Scientists in the Maldives are trying different techniques to resurrect the reefs, from the use of electricity to promote growth to the search for more resilient species. As tourism and the population of the Maldives continue to grow, more land is needed for develop

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Behind the Stories
programme.desc: Kirsty Wark describes her experience of reporting from Scotland on The Queen's death, while Clive Myrie recalls what it was like covering the King's proclamation.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Talking Business
programme.desc: In this week's Talking Business, Aaron Heslehurst travels to Rabat to explore Morocco's push into big renewable energy projects. Morocco wants to be a net exporter of clean energy to its neighbours and Europe but it still sources 40% of its own electricity from imported coal. How realistic is Morocco's move towards net zero and how quickly can it achieve it.

programme.desc: Britain is experiencing the largest fall in living standards since records began almost 70 years ago, with the rising cost of everyday essentials - such as food and household bills - thought to have pushed many into poverty. ITV News' Daniel Hewitt has followed the impact of this crisis for more than a year and examines how it's changed lives across the country. programme.title: Life & Debt: Stories from the Edge
programme.desc: Britain is experiencing the largest fall in living standards since records began almost 70 years ago, with the rising cost of everyday essentials - such as food and household bills - thought to have pushed many into poverty. ITV News' Daniel Hewitt has followed the impact of this crisis for more than a year and examines how it's changed lives across the country. programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: Dour DI Jack Frost suspects a man he arrested years before for a series of bizarre assaults on children could have returned to the area and recommenced his unsavoury activities. He tracks down the culprit, who swears he has turned over a new leaf, and decides not to charge him - a decision that shocks fellow sleuth DS Maud, whose misgivings are later justified in tragic fashion. Starring David Jason, Peter Gunn, Susannah Doyle, Bruce Alexander, John Lyons and Gwyneth Powell

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: The doctor spends his last day in Portwenn seeing an influx of patients as he prepares to close down the surgery and move to London. As he bids farewell to old friends and sets off to leave the village, he sees Louisa's teaching assistant Tasha fall from the Harbour Day stage and stops to help. But the bigger hold-up comes when pregnant Louisa is involved in a car accident. Martin Clunes and Caroline Catz star

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: The curmudgeonly GP struggles to come to terms with his new role as a father, having planned to resume his career as a consultant in London before the arrival of his and Louisa's as-yet unnamed son. To make matters worse, he begins to have serious doubts about the competency of his replacement Dr Di Dibbs when she misdiagnoses a patient as well as herself. Martin is then dealt a devastating personal blow after hearing his aunt Joan has died. Starring Martin Clunes, Joanna Scanlan and Caroline Catz

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: On doctor's orders, the dapper Belgian sleuth visits Brighton for what he hopes will be a relaxing holiday, but it leads to one of the most absorbing cases he has ever faced - the disappearance of a cache of jewels. Mystery, starring David Suchet, with Hermione Norris, Philip Jackson and Sorcha Cusack

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Secrets could be exposed as Rosamund arrives at Downton following Edith's shock departure. Rose is delighted to introduce Atticus and his parents to the Abbey, while Anna and Bates start thinking about a fresh start, now that the worst of their problems are seemingly behind them. Molesley is concerned to see Daisy becoming disillusioned with her studies, and Isobel makes a happy announcement, but there may be trouble on the horizon. Violet has her hands full with her warring servants, while Mary and Blake seize an opportunity to send Gillingham a strong message

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Preparations are under way for Rose's wedding, but family tensions on both sides threaten to derail proceedings. Edith's arrangement with Marigold is happily working out, but how long can she and Cora conceal the truth from Robert? Denker reveals an unexpected side to her personality, which causes trouble for more than one of the servants. With the war memorial due to be unveiled, Mrs Patmore is still upset, but Robert has something up his sleeve. Branson comes to a heart-wrenching decision, and the storm clouds that have been gathering over Anna and Bates finally burst

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: It's the early autumn of 1924 and Rose's father-in-law Lord Sinderby has rented Brancaster Castle in Northumberland and invited the Crawleys to a grouse-shooting party. However, the Sinderbys' butler Stowell (guest star Alun Armstrong, New Tricks) has an axe to grind and a scandalous secret threatens to derail the holiday. Back at Downton, the servants hold the fort and unlikely later-life romances abound, while Bates takes drastic measures to clear Anna's name as she faces an uncertain future behind bars. The seasons change and another Christmas is enjoyed at the Abbey, where a heartbreaking farewell and a joyful reunion take place. Feature-length festive special, starring Hugh Bonneville, Maggie Smith, James Faulkner, Penny Downie, Joanne Froggatt and Brendan Coyle

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Mary's past catches up with her when an unwelcome visitor delivers an ultimatum, as secrets and rifts threaten the unity of the family. News about the running of Downton Hospital puts Violet on the warpath, while those below stairs find social changes are putting their futures in jeopardy and Daisy's good intentions at the Mallerton House auction have disastrous consequences. Final series of the costume drama, starring Maggie Smith, Hugh Bonneville and Michelle Dockery

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Plans for the wedding are gathering steam, but Lady Mary's meddling lands Carson in trouble with Mrs Hughes. Cora and Violet clash over plans for the hospital takeover, and Thomas's job search is proving disheartening. Mary comes up with a fresh idea that offers Anna new hope, prompting a trip to London, and Lady Edith faces challenges at the magazine although it's a problem closer to home that reaches breaking point. A day out for the family and servants ends in panic and leaves Robert facing a difficult decision

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A guest at a village Halloween party boasts of having witnessed a murder years previously - and later meets a grisly end in keeping with the macabre spirit of the occasion. Arriving to investigate, Poirot delves back into the annals of local life - and uncovers a series of mysterious deaths, any one of which could have a bearing on the present case. David Suchet, Amelia Bullmore and Zoe Wanamaker star

programme.title: An Audience with Jimmy Tarbuck
programme.desc: The Liverpudlian comic performs before a host of showbiz celebrities including Cilla Black, Bruce Forsyth, Billy Connolly, Michael Parkinson, Harry Secombe and Henry Cooper. Jimmy will be fielding questions from the audience, and the event concludes with a special jam session featuring Hank Marvin, Rick Wakeman, Kenny Jones, Justin Hayward and John Lodge

programme.title: Karen Pirie
programme.desc: With the suspects under attack, Karen's case has become a live investigation overnight, but is this someone out for revenge, or is Rosie's killer trying to silence the truth? Thrown together with DS Phil Parhatka at the most awkward time, Karen and her team try to overcome the judgement of her superiors and find the culprit in time. Crime drama, starring Lauren Lyle

programme.title: Ladies of Letters
programme.desc: Irene and Vera have a disastrous reunion at a funeral after a long breakdown in their friendship. Comedy, starring Maureen Lipman and Anne Reid, based on the books and radio series by Carole Hayman and Lou Wakefield

programme.title: Ladies of Letters
programme.desc: Vera begins associating with some decidedly unsavoury new acquaintances, and sends one of them to settle a score with Irene - who responds by deciding it would be prudent to go and visit her daughter in Australia. Comedy, starring Maureen Lipman and Anne Reid

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Sarah falls for the manservant of Capt Ryttsen, a dashing Swedish army officer who is staying in the Bellamy household as a guest of James, but later finds herself suspected of betraying her employers' trust by stealing from them. Vintage drama, starring Pauline Collins and Simon Williams

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: A gangland killing takes a surprising twist when it turns out the victim has been sexually mutilated. Andy punishes Janet by keeping her out of the heart of the investigation, and when she rebels, the ensuing row becomes personal. Rachel feels ambushed by Sean, who announces his mother wants to meet her - especially as she has spent years trying not to think about her own mum. Suranne Jones, Lesley Sharp, Sean Maguire and Nicholas Gleaves star

programme.desc: Oliver is delighted when Simon's ex-wife takes him under her wing, but her former husband is terrified she intends to stay for good. Comedy, with Donald Sinden and Windsor Davies

programme.desc: Eccentric inventor Caractacus Potts rescues an old car from the scrapheap, only to discover it has magical, gravity-defying powers. Meanwhile, Baron Bomburst, the blundering ruler of Vulgaria, will do anything to get his greedy hands on it. Children's musical adventure, based on the book by Ian Fleming, starring Dick Van Dyke, Lionel Jeffries, Sally Ann Howes, Gert Frobe, Benny Hill and James Robertson Justice

programme.title: Goodnight Mister Tom (1998)
programme.desc: John Thaw stars in this adaptation of Michelle Magorian's wartime novel as Tom Oakley, an irascible widower whose life is changed for ever when nine-year-old London evacuee Willie is billeted in his cottage. The youngster takes to village life and the pair develop a strong bond - which looks set to be broken when Willie's tyrannical mother summons him back to the capital. Co-starring Nick Robinson and Annabelle Apsion

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Lord Ashfordly antagonises local ramblers by closing off a public footpath across his land, while Greengrass appoints himself Aidensfield's new chimney-sweep _ but displays his usual reluctance to actually do any work, convinced he can make far more money by conning soon-to-be-married couples into hiring him as a 'lucky' wedding guest. Rural drama, starring Bill Maynard and Rupert Vansittart

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: Debbie tells Cain that Charity is planning a last-ditch bid to save her marriage, while Zoe sets off for an evening in the Woolpack, leaving Chris alone at Home Farm

programme.desc: Eddie and Bob entertain a crowded Woolpack with their escapology act, but then sombre-looking police officers arrive and take Zoe outside to break devastating news

programme.desc: Deirdre urges a despondent Ken to fight for his job, Richard plays another nasty trick on Audrey and Roy decides his campaign against the arcade needs a radical new approach

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Jones are called away from a team-building exercise to investigate a fatal explosion at a haulage yard in Calham Cross. The property is owned by Territorial Army commanding officer Matt Parkes, the father of a businessman whose ruthlessness in the boardroom is matched only by his behaviour toward women. To complicate matters, the village is also home to a peace protester and a grieving mother - and Barnaby has to decide if any of these locals is capable of arson and murder. John Nettles and Jason Hughes star, with Tim Pigott-Smith, Joseph Millson, Niamh Cusack, Judy Parfitt and Nick Fletcher

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Mr Carson and Mrs Hughes' wedding is fast approaching, but a misunderstanding threatens to derail the occasion, and when the big day arrives it also brings a few unexpected guests. Meanwhile, Edith reconnects with an old acquaintance, who comes to her aid in her hour of need, and over at the Dower House, Spratt has something to hide, meaning Denker is hot on his trail. Daisy jumps to conclusions about one of the countess's plots, and tensions mount over the hospital takeover, prompting Isobel to offend a friend. Period drama, starring Jim Carter, Phyllis Logan, Elizabeth McGovern and Laura Carmichael

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: The Aidensfield bobbies investigate a series of arson attacks, but have trouble finding the evidence to convict their chief suspects _ until a further blaze claims a victim. Elsewhere, Maggie receives shocking news, and Greengrass fancies himself as the village's answer to Billy Butlin, opening a disused railway carriage as a holiday home. Guest starring Ralf Little and Coronation Street's Alan Halsall (Tyrone Dobbs)

McDonald and Dodds must separate the fact from the fiction as they try to discover whether Rose's life was really as glamorous as it looked.

programme.title: Wild at Heart

Guest starring Maggie O'Neill

programme.desc: When Du Plessis discovers a rare white lion in the Bush, the residents of Leopard's Den resolve to keep its existence a secret. Rosie feels guilty about neglecting her relationship with Max to tend to an ailing rooikat, and Caroline enlists the girl's help to track down the poachers. Kriel's wife Amy (EastEnders star Jessie Wallace) arrives on the reserve

programme.desc: The sleuth receives an unexpected visit from a provincial schoolteacher who is convinced that he will be accused of murdering his village's spiteful postmistress. Detective drama, starring Michael Gambon

programme.desc: The police decide there is sufficient evidence to justify a murder investigation, and warn Zoe to stay away from Home Farm until they have finished their enquiries

programme.title: Classic Emmerdale
programme.desc: The police begin their investigations at Home Farm and, after learning the cause of death, set about dissecting the crime scene. Before long, an arrest is made

programme.desc: Todd goes out on a limb and tells Sarah how he really feels about her, Kevin and Sally consider taking their relationship further, and Richard continues to persecute Audrey

programme.title: Classic Coronation Street
programme.desc: Audrey stops Richard in his tracks by announcing she is getting her locks changed, and Jason offers Todd brotherly advice, while Sally and Kevin enjoy a night out

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Two couples disappear in the tiny village of Monks Barton amid rumours of witchcraft and haunted woods. As Barnaby and Jones investigate, psychic Cyrus LeVanu clashes with cleric Wallace Stone over their different methods of 'healing' the woods, while other locals seem to be caught up in a stolen antiques racket. When a body is unearthed and the death toll rises, the detectives race to catch the killer by finding a connection between the missing couples and the thefts. Anton Lesser guest stars, with John Nettles and Jason Hughes

programme.title: Downton Abbey
programme.desc: Tom and Sybbie return to Downton, but the peace is disrupted by an unexpected visit from an old friend. Baxter is faced with a dilemma after an encounter with Sergeant Willis, while Thomas struggles to fill Carson's shoes. Anna goes to London with Mary to deal with a crisis, while her secrets seem likely to be exposed. Daisy is not happy with Cora, and Mary has an admirer

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: An eccentric elderly lady reports an abduction, presenting the Aidensfield coppers with a fresh mystery to solve, while Greengrass has dealings with an old crony who wants him to enter a champion ferret in a race. Rural drama, starring Bill Maynard, Derek Fowlds and Margery Mason

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The peace of the sleepy hamlet of Little Worthy is disturbed when a man's body is found tied down in a miniature village - just like the hero in classic tale Gulliver's Travels. As the investigation begins, Barnaby has no shortage of suspects, including the victim's recently jilted partner - a teacher whose classroom is full of paintings of the story - his teenage lover, a caretaker and a hotel owner. But the case takes a twist when the killer strikes again amid the chaos of the annual fancy-dress boat race. Detective drama, guest starring Jesse Birdsall and Olivia Colman, with John Nettles and Jason Hughes

programme.title: The Professionals
programme.desc: The resources of CI5 are stretched when a mentally unbalanced former soldier starts killing hospital staff, believing them responsible for the death of his wife and for the brain damage suffered by his young daughter. Drama, starring Martin Shaw and Lewis Collins

programme.title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: An interpreter claims to have been abducted by two villains who forced him to interrogate a badly bruised and obviously distressed Greek captive unable to speak English. Period detective drama, starring Jeremy Brett

programme.title: The Champions
programme.desc: The team is called in to help Scotland Yard track a source of contaminated drugs which have been found in discos all around London. programme.title: Magnum, PI
programme.desc: Robin offends Thomas by hiring security expert Joy 'Digger' Doyle as protection from a mysterious adversary determined to prevent the publication of his latest novel. Detective drama, starring Tom Selleck and Erin Gray

programme.title: The Champions
programme.desc: The trio pose as domestic staff to protect the life of a former dictator. Inevitably, domestic duties give way to dangerous circumstances. Fantasy drama, starring William Gaunt, Alexandra Bastedo and Stuart Damon

programme.title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: A solicitor enlists Holmes to help clear him of murdering eccentric builder Jonas Oldacre, whose considerable personal fortune he stood to inherit. Drama, starring Jeremy Brett as the famed Victorian detective

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: Extreme angler Jeremy Wade heads to Russia's remote Amur River, where the mysterious deaths of three men appear to be linked to a freshwater giant - a beast that can exceed 18ft in length and weigh more than a ton. However, he encounters a wall of silence and begins to suspect he has stumbled on to a dark secret that isn't supposed to be uncovered

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: News of a violent attack in a remote Mongolian river has Jeremy Wade wondering if it could be the work of a giant fish so rare that it's more legend than fact. But with illegal gold miners poisoning the last hideouts of this man-sized monster, it's anyone's guess whether the creature is still alive and biting

programme.title: Magnum, PI
programme.desc: A fitness trainer offers to knock Magnum into shape in time for an Iron Man contest in return for finding her missing fiance. Detective drama, starring Tom Selleck

programme.title: The Professionals
programme.desc: Bodie and Doyle are asked to keep a surveillance on Cowley after evidence suggests he has stolen two canisters of a lethal nerve gas and begun negotiating with an unfriendly foreign power. The plot thickens when they trace their boss to a country mansion, where after they are caught he denies knowing them

programme.title: Minder
programme.desc: A professional gambler needs to hide a group of people who might be able to help him win at roulette, so Arthur hits on the idea of using Terry's flat. Comedy drama, guest starring Anthony Valentine and featuring a pre-Birds of a Feather Lesley Joseph

programme.title: Giant Lobster Hunters
programme.desc: Clive, Skipper of the Minnamurra, needs to jump start his catch rate if he's any chance of turning a profit for the season. Meanwhile, in the Bass Strait, Skipper Danny is using a depth sounder to locate the shallow reef bottoms because that's where the giant red lobsters are feeding - it's monster after monster for the crew of William Norling

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Chizzy Akudolu, Andrew Pierce, Sonja McLaughlan and Jack Carroll pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught

programme.title: Hulk (2003)
programme.desc: Scientist Dr Bruce Banner turns into the rampaging green Hulk after exposure to a huge dose of gamma radiation, prompting the military to embark on a no-holds-barred mission to destroy the monster. Comic-book adventure from director Ang Lee, starring Eric Bana, Jennifer Connelly, Sam Elliott and Nick Nolte

Their 78-year-old mother Inge desperate for Nino to turn the business around, but the feuding family members will have to solve their differences first

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the first night in Peterborough, 39-year-old land surveyor and part-time musician Muneer hopes to win over his guests with a menu based on Pakistani recipes passed down through his family for generations. The authenticity extends beyond his food, with Muneer seating his guests on the floor of his specially dressed dining room. His guests include driving instructor Christine, hairdresser Ben, fiery Brazilian Rosie and fridge salesman Gregory. While his food receives mixed reviews, His guests discover his master plan for musical success, suffer bad jokes and find out that one of their fellow diners believes in mermaids

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Peterborough, driving instructor Christine hopes her vegetarian cuisine will grab her the 1,000 prize. However, with everyone dreading Christine's meat-free and bland-sounding menu, Rosie may not be the only one who has to bite her lip

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Peterborough, mobile hairdresser Ben plans a gourmet night. Most of his guests are looking forward to some meat after Christine's vegetarian feast the night before. programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Fiery Brazilian Rosie is confident that her night will be the best of the week in Peterborough. Northampton newlyweds Nikki and Andy both worked from home but their cluttered terrace was close to bursting point. Meanwhile, Amber ran her own fitness classes from her home and wanted somewhere brighter and bigger for her clients. Could Kirstie persuade them to go with her redesigns or would Phil find either couple a much more suitable new place?

programme.title: Sarah Beeny's New Life in the Country
programme.desc: Sarah and Graham turn their attention to the family room and how best to use the empty space downstairs. They draw inspiration from the Chinese bedroom at Longleat House and the plant-based textiles and natural dyes on display at London Fashion Week. Sarah realises that she can't carry on working in random parts of the house, so comes up with a plan to seamlessly weave her workspace into the living area.

programme.title: Andrew: The Problem Prince
programme.desc: The first of two programmes telling the inside story of Prince Andrew's 2019 Newsnight interview with Emily Maitlis and the subsequent chain of events that led to a royal disaster. In the 1980s, Andrew was a Falklands war hero and a national heart-throb, glory years that culminated in his marriage to Sarah Ferguson. But following his departure from the Navy, his image took a turn as his new role as trade envoy proved unsuccessful - and his need to fund a lavish lifestyle and friendship with Jeffrey Epstein eventually prompted the interview that cemented his downfall

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: A nutrition student hoping to meet a man who is open with his feelings finds she is not used to compliments during a date with a football coach, and has to brush up on her flirting. programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer look back on two period properties that desperately needed to be adapted for modern-day living. Plus, a look behind the scenes at the award-winning bakery and a glimpse of what the future may hold for a company yet to embrace online shopping

programme.title: Ruby Wax: Cast Away

programme.title: Billion Dollar Holiday Resort: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: A look at Baha Mar in the Bahamas, a resort that has 11 swimming pools, 40 restaurants and bars, a 100,000 square-foot casino and its own squadron of trained sharks. Perched on a stretch of white-sand beach, this enormous hotel complex can accommodate up to 7,000 people at once, and cameras take a closer look at one of the world's most luxurious resorts

programme.title: Britain's Greatest Bridges
programme.desc: Engineer Rob Bell sets out on a journey to discover how six of Britain's most stunning bridges were designed and built. Completed in 1890, the Forth Rail Bridge now carries around 200 trains every day. The last of the great Victorian engineering triumphs, it has grown to symbolise Scotland as much as Edinburgh Castle, bagpipes or kilts. But, as Rob learns, this incredible engineering achievement was born from the tragedy of the 1879 Tay Bridge disaster, and 73 deaths were connected with its construction and immediate aftermath

programme.title: Britain's Greatest Bridges
programme.desc: For years, London's East End was denied a new bridge because of the need to guarantee passage of ships up and down the Thames. For years, the greatest engineers of the age hunted for a design that would keep both road and water traffic moving. As Rob Bell explains, the solution came from architect Horace Jones, whose revolutionary design, with its thousand-tonne opening sections, was powered by nothing more than water. Rob also explains the bridge was lucky to survive the Second World War, having been a target for German V-1 flying bombs

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: Ann Maurice and Alistair Appleton visit Scraptoft in Leicester, where a five-bedroom house valued at 229,500 needs a makeover to enhance its appeal. The kitchen is transformed into the hub of family life and a lounge is converted into a dining room, while unfortunate colour clashes are toned down

programme.desc: The cheeky piglet helps Grandpa Pig carve his pumpkin. However, it is so big they worry they might not be able to get it to the pumpkin competition

programme.title: Pip and Posy
programme.desc: The friends play a fun game where they cannot touch the ground for fear that crocodiles will chomp them in Croc Attack

programme.title: Fantastic Mr Fox (2009)
programme.desc: A rebellious fox decides it is time to grow up and change his chicken-stealing ways for the sake of his wife and children. However, the presence of three wicked farmers near his woodland home proves a challenge he cannot resist. Stop-motion animated adventure based on the novel by Roald Dahl, with the voices of George Clooney, Meryl Streep, Jason Schwartzman and Bill Murray

programme.title: The Adventures of Tintin (2011)
programme.desc: A reporter's purchase of a model ship brings him under threat from a ruthless criminal, as it is one of a series of clues to the location of the real vessel, which holds a pirate's lost treasure. He sets off on a globetrotting quest to find it, assisted by a drunken sea captain, two bumbling detectives and his faithful dog. Steven Spielberg's animated adventure based on Herge's comic-strip series, with the voices of Jamie Bell, Andy Serkis and Daniel Craig

programme.title: Bee Movie (2007)
programme.desc: A bee wearies of a life dedicated to producing honey and decides to leave his hive. During his foray into the wider world, he befriends a florist. However, when he realises what becomes of the honey his species toils so hard to make, he resolves to sue the entire human race for stealing from his fellow creatures. Animated comedy, with the voices of Jerry Seinfeld, Renee Zellweger and Chris Rock

programme.title: Star Trek IV: The Voyage Home (1986)
programme.desc: The Enterprise crew travels back in time to prevent an alien probe destroying the Earth. The only thing that can avert the disaster is a humpback whale, a creature extinct in the 23rd century - but adjusting to life back in 1986 proves a distinct challenge. Sci-fi adventure sequel, starring William Shatner, DeForest Kelley and Leonard Nimoy, who also directed

programme.title: The Nanny Diaries (2007)
programme.desc: College graduate Annie takes a job as a nanny to a wealthy family. However, her demanding employers and their spoiled son prove impossible to cope with, and as she falls for a handsome neighbour, she begins to wonder what she really wants out of life. Comedy, starring Scarlett Johansson, Laura Linney and Paul Giamatti

programme.title: Deadpool 2 (2018)
programme.desc: The wisecracking anti-hero meets Russell, a gifted youngster pursued by a heavily armed cyborg from the future. With the aid of fellow mutant Domino and five less lucky teammates, they attempt to defeat the villainous Cable. Action comedy, starring Ryan Reynolds, Josh Brolin, Julian Dennison and Zazie Beetz

programme.title: Blood Simple (1983)
programme.desc: A man's plot to murder his wife and her lover is ruined by a seedy private eye whose underhand dealings set off a bizarre and horrific chain of events. Downbeat noir thriller from the Coen brothers, starring Frances McDormand, John Getz and M Emmet Walsh

programme.title: The American Friend (1977)
programme.desc: A would-be murderer persuades a neighbour to aid his diabolical plot by convincing his unsuspecting friend he is suffering from a fatal disease and therefore has nothing to lose. Wim Wenders' drama based on Patricia Highsmith's novel Ripley's Game, starring Dennis Hopper and Bruno Ganz

programme.title: Carry On Constable (1960)
programme.desc: A flu epidemic leaves a police station short of staff, forcing a desperate inspector to send four bungling trainees on the beat. The inept would-be bobbies manage to increase the crime rate even before they have started work, and their long-suffering sergeant faces an uphill battle to whip them into shape. Comedy, starring Sid James, Kenneth Williams, Kenneth Connor, Charles Hawtrey and Joan Sims

programme.title: The Red Turtle (2016)
programme.desc: After a devastating storm leaves him shipwrecked on a deserted island, a nameless mariner must find a way to survive. After several failed attempts to sail off into the vast oceans on rafts built from bamboo, he encounters a red turtle, and the two strike up an unspoken bond. Animated fantasy, starring Emmanuel Garijo. In French and Japanese

programme.title: Bridge to Terabithia (2007)
programme.desc: Twelve-year-old Jess befriends a new girl at school, and the pair begin to create their own imaginary kingdom in a secret place in the woods to escape the difficulties of their real lives. Unfortunately, a tragedy threatens to bring their fantasy world to an end. Drama based on Katherine Paterson's novel, starring Josh Hutcherson, AnnaSophia Robb, Zooey Deschanel and Robert Patrick

programme.title: Star Trek V: The Final Frontier (1989)
programme.desc: The Starship Enterprise races to the rescue of intergalactic ambassadors held hostage on a distant planet. The crisis proves to be the handiwork of a renegade Vulcan mystic who kidnaps Captain Kirk and his crew, ordering them to fly to an unexplored world where he hopes to fulfil his insane ambition - to meet God. Sci-fi adventure, written, directed by and starring William Shatner, with Leonard Nimoy, DeForest Kelley and David Warner

programme.title: The Karate Kid (2010)
programme.desc: An American youngster goes to live in China with his mother, where he becomes an outsider and falls foul of the local bullies. He receives help from the kindly school caretaker, who turns out to be a kung fu master and offers to train the boy to defend himself. Martial arts drama, with Jaden Smith and Jackie Chan

programme.title: Infinite (2021)
programme.desc: A man who finds himself troubled by memories that are not his and developing skills he never learned is recruited by a mysterious organisation. The members of this group have learned to access the experiences of their past lives, but one has gone rogue, and must be stopped in his efforts to end the cycle of reincarnation by destroying all human life. Sci-fi thriller, starring Mark Wahlberg and Chiwetel Ejiofor

programme.title: Blue Steel (1989)
programme.desc: A police officer shoots an armed robber, but is suspended from duty when the criminal's gun cannot be found. The weapon has been stolen from the crime scene by a stockbroker who becomes obsessed with the incident, and begins dating the cop while secretly using the gun to carry out a murder spree. Kathryn Bigelow's thriller, starring Jamie Lee Curtis, Ron Silver and Clancy Brown

programme.title: Mickey and the Bear (2019)
programme.desc: A strong-willed Montana teenager is faced with the responsibility of taking care of her struggling veteran father, who is also an addict, and their difficult relationship only serves to fuel her desire for independence. Coming-of-age drama, starring Camila Morrone, James Badge Dale and Calvin Demba

programme.title: Samson and Delilah (1949)
programme.desc: Hebrew warrior Samson becomes a wanted man after crossing paths with Philistine troops, but he constantly thwarts their efforts to capture him using to his incredible strength. Determined to bring him down, the Saran of Gaza makes use of his beguiling sister Delilah, who seduces Samson and manages to rob him of the source of his power. Cecil B DeMille's Oscar-winning adaptation of the biblical tale, starring Victor Mature, Hedy Lamarr, George Sanders, Angela Lansbury and Henry Wilcox

programme.title: The Last Hurrah (1958)
programme.desc: John Ford's political drama, starring Spencer Tracy as a headstrong New England mayor who launches one final re-election campaign. However, he finds the nature of politics is changing and that he has a powerful enemy in a wealthy and influential local banker (Basil Rathbone). Also starring Jeffrey Hunter and Pat O'Brien

programme.title: Young Winston (1972)
programme.desc: Biopic of Winston Churchill, following the future prime minister's formative years. While working as a journalist, he travels to Africa to report on the Boer Wars, an assignment that leads to his incarceration in a prison camp. He escapes from captivity and returns to England to begin a political career. Directed by Richard Attenborough and starring Simon Ward, Anthony Hopkins, Anne Bancroft and Robert Shaw

programme.title: Star Trek VI: The Undiscovered Country (1991)
programme.desc: Captain Kirk is framed for the assassination of the Klingon head of state just as the Federation is about to make peace with their old enemies. As Kirk and Dr McCoy are banished to an icy prison planet, Spock tries to uncover the identity of the real killers. Sci-fi adventure sequel, with William Shatner, Leonard Nimoy, DeForest Kelley, Christopher Plummer, with appearances by Christian Slater and Michael Dorn from Star Trek: The Next Generation

programme.title: 12 Strong (2018)
programme.desc: The story of the first Special Forces team deployed to Afghanistan after 9/11. Under the leadership of a new captain, the team must work with an Afghan warlord to take down the Taliban. War drama, based on Doug Stanton's non-fiction book Horse Soldiers, starring Chris Hemsworth, Michael Shannon and Michael Pena

programme.title: Dreamland (2020)
programme.desc: During the Great Depression, Eugene Evans dreams of escaping his small Texas town when he discovers a wounded, fugitive bank robber. Torn between claiming the bounty for her capture and his growing attraction to the seductive criminal, Eugene must make a decision that will affect the lives of everyone he's ever loved. Romantic drama, starring Finn Cole and Margot Robbie

programme.title: Battle of the Sexes (2017)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Third to host are Alec and Craig Coleman, who open the doors to the Edenfield Guest House in Blackpool and invite their fellow B&B owners to rate their establishment. programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to the New Inn, Portland, Dorset, for the fourth day of the competition, where hosts Stacey and Spencer Cullum introduce their guests to a typical island activity - sandcastle building. programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The four sets of owners meet one last time to discover how much their rivals thought they should receive and to settle some scores. programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Oil and gas co-ordinator Danielle Greenwood is keen to impress as she hosts the first dinner party in the Merseyside area, as she welcomes divorcee Jade Chantelle Short, Michael Buble impersonator Jamie Somers, pastoral care manager Steven Booth, and nursery school teacher Anna Senior into her home. Danielle takes no risks with a down-to-earth menu, which she hopes will help bag her the 1,000 prize at the end of the week

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Pastoral care manager Steven Booth hosts the second Merseyside dinner party, and names each course after a Tina Turner song, hoping to win the 1,000 prize. The food is well received, but tensions rise when one guest makes a tactless comment

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Glamorous PR representative Jade Chantelle hosts the third night in Merseyside, where she hopes a casino-themed evening with lashings of champagne and a high-class menu will help her to win the 1,000 prize

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Primary school teacher Anna Senior hosts the fourth night in Merseyside with a fairy tale-themed evening. Her menu consists of a Mad Hatter's soup and sandwich, a special pork dish cooked three ways and baked cheesecake for dessert, but she must try to control the tension between Jamie and Jade to have a successful party

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Michael Bubl impersonator Jamie Somers hosts the final Merseyside dinner party, but may have to put aside his differences with guest Jade if he is to be crowned the winner of the 1,000 cash prize

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Staff and patients at St George's in south west London talk about the importance of family support when dealing with difficult circumstances. Fifty-one-year-old painter and decorator Gary is rushed to St George's after falling 10 feet from a ladder. Cameras also follow five-year-old Beatriz, who has symptoms of a fever. She has a rare kidney condition that affects her immune system, making her vulnerable to infection

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Paramedics treat a man who has injured himself while wheeling a push bike home and is in agony. The paramedics are concerned he has broken his hip. A daughter discovers her mum has died suddenly at home and calls for help. As the death is unexpected not only does the daughter have to confront her grief but she's also faced with a raft of necessary bureaucracy

programme.title: The Good Doctor

programme.title: Kirstie's Vintage Gems
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp enlists the help of paper-cutting expert Poppy Chancellor to make personalised wedding invitations for a couple about to tie the knot. Plus, the inventive presenter creates a craft collage to celebrate the arrival of a newborn baby

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Friends Carmen and Tanya are looking for a holiday home on the Caribbean island of Antigua, so Danni Menzies searches for something in Carmen's 390,000 price range

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A former DJ from Skegness opens a bar in Portugal, but falls foul of the law, while a couple's renovation of a B&B in Italy continues with one of them stuck in Wales

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: The team visits Swindon and Chippenham, where Henry Cole finds and restores a much-maligned BSA Ariel 3 moped and Simon O'Brien gives a Ford Transit gearbox a new lease of life

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: In Sheffield, Henry Cole makes good money restoring an antique pine sideboard, but has less success with a pair of old brass jugs. And Simon O'Brien converts a staircase into shelves and makes an eye-watering profit from restoring an optician's desk

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate researchers look for the heirs of a man whose family worked for London Underground during the Blitz. programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate officers search for the heirs of an unclaimed estate, and reveal the story of a woman who left her native Ireland in the 1950s and was not heard of again until she died leaving a legacy of 1.7million. Plus, more details of unclaimed assets

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition moves to the Wheatsheaf Inn in Exning, near Newmarket, Suffolk, where guests are welcomed by owner Ken Clutterbuck and employee Ginny Trow. programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Sherrill Tacy hosts at the Sherwood Guesthouse in New Brighton on the Wirral, and is praised for the establishment's value for money. However, there is upset when her breakfast leaves a lot to be desired, and her final review is far from perfect

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Final hosts Mark and Rachael Dann welcome the contestants to the Big Bear Lodge in Shropshire. programme.title: Four in a Bed

After the deliberations are over, the winning guest house is announced

programme.title: Come Dine with Me: The Professionals
programme.desc: Professional chefs battle it out in the kitchen in a series celebrates the wonderful variety of restaurants and the amazing characters who work in them. First to host in Yorkshire are chef Ben and front of house Jo, at their intimate dining restaurant, The Barn. Second hosts, chef Brian and his business partner and other half Lisa, hope that their eclectic menu of French classics and a platter of street food at Disco Kitchen will impress their guests. For the final night, owner and chef Simon and his manager Sakina from Scandi-inspired restaurant Fint put on a spread

programme.title: Elizabeth & Margaret: Becoming Royals
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the lives of Elizabeth II and Princess Margaret, to discover the real sisters beyond the royal splendour, balcony and cheering crowds

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud revisits Andy and Nicki Bruce, who were building an experimental amphibious house on a small island on the Thames in Buckinghamshire. They spent 1.2million on one of the most ambitious Grand Designs ever, but the logistical headache of building on an island only accessible by a narrow footbridge soon became clear. Heavy machinery was swept away by the river, contractors were changed, and the site was hit by severe storms, causing delays and resulting in an unfinished and untested building. Kevin returns to find out what living on a regularly flooded piece of land is like, and whether the floating home performed when the river burst its banks in January 2015

programme.title: Britain's Most Luxurious Train Journeys
programme.desc: On the Statesman train, travelling to Snowdonia in north Wales, a retired train driver is surprised with a heritage steam railway ride from the historic mining town of Blaenau Ffestiniog. Luxury train regulars Gary and Kim celebrate their first wedding anniversary with a return trip back to where they spent their first holiday together

programme.title: The Mystery of the Crossrail Skulls
programme.desc: Documentary examining the discovery of dozens of Roman-era skulls by engineers working beneath London's Liverpool Street station. The remains have been identified as dating back to Roman times, but it has yet to be determined who these people were and how their heads ended up buried on the site. Archaeologists examine the bones for evidence of the various theories that have been suggested, questioning whether the skulls belonged to gladiators, executed rebels or the victims of a massacre, or formed part of a grisly ritual

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Medics at St George's hospital treat three women who have been stabbed in a Surrey supermarket car park in broad daylight. Meanwhile, friends and relations recall their associations with the wounded, Jean, 67, Rani, 71, and Janet, 62

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The boys embark on a mission of Biblical proportions: to find the source of the Nile using three ageing motors to negotiate traffic, mudslides, and crocodile-infested waters

programme.desc: James concludes his examination of the social significance of cars by exploring how aspiration and new wealth were behind the development of some of the greatest models ever made. He tries to make sense of the baffling world of company car hierarchy by holding a travelling salesman race-off and indulges his 1980s urges with the twin delights of a Lamborghini and a Porsche. He also unveils his choice of the ultimate people's car - a vehicle that can lay claim to being the greatest in history

programme.title: James May's Cars of the People
programme.desc: James charts the history of 4x4 vehicles from the jeeps of the Second World war onwards, revealing how they rose in popularity in everyday use and in rallies. He explores the rivalry between Land Rover and Land Cruiser, and puts some classic vehicles through their paces by driving up Mount Fuji and through the Mojave desert

programme.title: World's Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: Hugh Dennis and David Baddiel travel along more than 1,200 miles of hazardous roads in Ethiopia on a journey to Aksum, the country's holiest place. However, they have to contend with more than fatigue and unreliable terrain to reach their destination, as they encounter drug-taking truck drivers, suffer a disastrous breakdown and start to run out of fuel at the worst possible time

programme.title: World's Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: Celebrities undertake some of the most perilous journeys in the world. Driving up Madagascar's eastern coast at the tail end of the rainy season is enough to test the best of friendships, but comedy actor Angus Deayton and broadcaster Mariella Frostrup are game enough to take on the challenge, and good enough friends to poke fun at each other along the way. The route has numerous river crossings and the duo face a variety of broken bridges and flimsy ferries as the only way across, while the roads themselves are mired with thick mud. Progress becomes increasingly painful and they are finally forced to spend a night in the car

programme.desc: Gavin starts his job in Cardiff and, while Stacey is thrilled to be back in Wales, Smithy has to come to terms with living in Essex without his best friend. Along the way, they encounter drug lords and feel the effects of altitude sickness as they negotiate the region's roads, one of which is a notoriously dangerous 40-mile mountain pass dubbed El Camino de la Muerte - the Death Road

programme.desc: Twenty Twelve co-stars Hugh Bonneville and Jessica Hynes pair up again to go on a road trip through the former Soviet republic of Georgia. While the drive is a challenge all the way, the country and its people delight and surprise them at every turn

programme.title: World's Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: Comedians Phill Jupitus and Marcus Brigstocke head to Bolivia for a high-altitude trip, first driving along the infamous 'Road of Death', only to find themselves deep in bandit country. Disorientation takes them by surprise as they have to navigate Salar de Uyuni - a salt lake so vast that Buzz Aldrin could see it from space. Their goal is the ancient mountain city of Potosi, whose silver mines financed the Spanish empire in the 16th century and which is almost 5,000 metres above sea level

programme.desc: People forced out of their homes in Honduras by the notorious MS-13 gang plead their case for asylum in America. Officers discover 3,000lb of marijuana hidden in a cargo truck

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick visits Tintagel, Cornwall's most mythical place, which was an important trading port with Europe and the birthplace of perhaps Britain's greatest legend - the tale of King Arthur. He also learns how the Methodists were important to Cornwall, and how they would cook a rather unusual bun during feast days, and meets a family on the Roseland Peninsula who are continuing the surprisingly ancient tradition of growing an exotic spice - saffron

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick explores the rich and diverse history of West Penwith, the farthest point west in mainland Britain. He visits Lamorna Cove, made famous through song and art, and the Unesco-protected tin and copper mining area of Botallack, where he talks to a mining explorer. The chef also follows an ancient track in search of Cornwall's oldest building and reveals how, as a young lad on the Lizard Peninsula, he fell in love for the first time and tasted his first French fish stew - known as a bouillabaisse

programme.title: Cops on the Rock

programme.desc: The Hornby team races to complete a model of the giant P2, The Prince of Wales locomotive, determined to be the first to bring a model of this giant to market

programme.title: Hornby: A Model World
programme.desc: The Scalextric team attempt to tap into the brand's glory years, the 1980s, and devise a plan to create a model of a classic supercar, the Lamborghini Countach

programme.title: Hornby: A Model World
programme.desc: The iconic Locomotive Flying Scotsman is scaled down 120 times from real life, rendering some features almost invisible to the naked eye, or too small to even mould

programme.title: Hornby: A Model World
programme.desc: Young designer Prad has just 30 days to reinvent the model railway starter kit, and musician Jools Holland reveals his incredible 45ft layout hidden away in his loft

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Japan
programme.desc: The actress flies over Tokyo in a helicopter. The city was bombed extensively during the Second World War, so almost all of it is a symbol of the post-war economic boom that saw Japan become the world's second largest economy. While in the capital, Joanna heads out to a nightclub to see a Japanese girl band and witnesses the largely male audience perform almost as much as the artists on stage. Later, Joanna travels to the Kiso Valley to walk the Nakasendo Way, an ancient route that once linked Tokyo to Kyoto, a place best known for that most famous of Japanese traditions, the Geisha

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Japan
programme.desc: The actress heads to the island of Shikoku hoping to gain a better understanding of Japanese Buddhism. She then takes a bullet train to another island - Kyushu - where she finds the Henn Na Hotel, the world's first robot hotel. At Nagasaki, she visits Shiroyama Elementary school, one of the only buildings to survive the atomic bomb dropped on the city in 1945. Joanna then travels to Sakurajima, one of the country's most active volcanoes, before heading to the islands of Okinawa where one of the bloodiest battles of the Second World War was fought

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Trans-Siberian Adventure
programme.desc: The actress embarks on her third travelogue, having previously traced the Nile from its source and sampled the varied rural, historical and urban cultures of Greece. This time, she sets out to travel 6,400 miles making use of the Trans-Siberian Railway, which is considered the longest railway line in the world. Joanna's journey begins in Hong Kong, where she spent some of her childhood. She takes a bullet train to Beijing, where she meets a woman who claims to have known the last Chinese emperor's favourite concubine, and officially joins the Trans-Siberian track. From there, she travels to the Great Wall, and takes an overnight train into Mongolia via the Gobi desert

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Trans-Siberian Adventure
programme.desc: The actress reaches the midway point of her 6,000-mile journey from Hong Kong to Moscow via the Trans-Siberian Railway, taking in the varied sights of Mongolia. She spends time with native nomads, and visits a giant statue of Genghis Khan, as well as a gold mine. She also heads to the nation's capital, Ulan Bator, where she tracks down the famous Mongolian throat-singers, before catching a train bound for Russia. However, making a start on the Siberian leg of her trek proves more difficult than Joanna expects when she experiences a spot of bother at the border

programme.desc: Long-suffering Margaret finally collapses with exhaustion, so Victor tries to nurse her back to health - but his bedside manner only makes matters worse. Comedy, starring Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael begins his latest journey in the sailing town of Lymington, where he makes a life-saving discovery. The route takes him through the Dorchester countryside, where he discovers how the introduction of the railway inspired Thomas Hardy. He tries his hand at carpet-making in Axminster and concludes his journey in Exmouth, where he learns about the work of forgotten Victorian landscape artist Francis Danby

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: In Plymouth, Michael Portillo finds out about the Royal Navy's fighting spirit and mixes his own blend of 'ruin'. Then, crossing into Cornwall, he learns about the last bridge to be built by renowned engineer Isambard Kingdom Brunel. By Tre, Pol and Pen, the ex-politician comes to know Cornishmen and how to prepare the perfect pasty. This leg of his journey ends in a small village, which in Victorian times became a hub of global communications

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on the first leg of a journey from Southampton to Wolverhampton, beginning by being taught how to set a table aboard the luxury liner Queen Elizabeth. In the village of Netley he finds the remains of an extensive military hospital built by order of Queen Victoria, and ends his travels in Basingstoke, where he learns out about a pitched battle between townspeople and the Salvation Army

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels through Hampshire and Berkshire, as he continues his journey to Wolverhampton. His stop-off points include Stratfield Saye House, the stately home bequeathed by the nation to Arthur Wellesley, 1st Duke of Wellington, in 1817. He then heads to Aldershot Garrison, where he is put through his paces under military instruction. At St Michael's Abbey in Farnborough, Michael visits the tomb of French emperor Napoleon III and his family, before ending in Crowthorne, Berkshire, the home of Broadmoor high-security psychiatric hospital

programme.desc: Michael Portillo sets out from Birmingham on the first leg of a trip to Dartmoor, and a visit to the city's town hall reveals a magnificent organ and the location for a celebrated music festival. programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Redditch to Gloucester, beginning with a look back to Victorian times at a needle manufactory. He also learns how to make Gloucester cheese and joins the Gloucester Choral Society in a rendition of Jerusalem

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: The next part of Michael Portillo's journey from Southampton to Wolverhampton begins in Wokingham, Berkshire, where the former politician finds out how demand from a growing number of rail commuters fuelled the development of the modern printing press. He then learns about a Tudor businessman who manufactured cloth in enormous volumes in Newbury, and ends this leg of his trip in Bradford on Avon, Wiltshire. Here, a local manufacturer describes how his Victorian forebears were the first in Britain to be licensed to vulcanise rubber

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: On the next stage of his journey to Wolverhampton, Michael Portillo visits Lacock Abbey near Chippenham in Wiltshire to find out how the world's first photographic negative was made.
